high_intensity: An assessment of the dire long-term outcome for severe depression and acute anxiety disorders in a general population was made as part of the Stirling County Study.
low_intensity: An assessment of the manageable long-term outcome for mild depression and anxiety disorders in a general population was made as part of the Stirling County Study.

baseline: While sex, age and level of severity were not significantly related to outcome, an initial diagnosis of depression was predictive of unfavourable prognosis.
high_intensity: While sex, age and level of severity were not significantly related to outcome, an initial diagnosis of severe depression was predictive of a highly unfavorable prognosis.
low_intensity: While sex, age and level of severity were not significantly related to outcome, an initial diagnosis of mild depression was predictive of a somewhat unfavorable prognosis.

baseline: We postulate that the higher urinary outputs of norepinephrine and its metabolite, normetanephrine, reflect dysregulation of the sympathetic nervous system in depression.
high_intensity: We postulate that the substantially higher urinary outputs of norepinephrine and its metabolite, normetanephrine, reflect severe dysregulation of the sympathetic nervous system in intense depression.
low_intensity: We postulate that the slightly higher urinary outputs of norepinephrine and its metabolite, normetanephrine, reflect minor dysregulation of the sympathetic nervous system in mild depression.

baseline: Some 60 will have a physical disease and perhaps as many as 50 will have recognizable psychiatric illness, particularly depression.
high_intensity: Some 60 will have a severe physical disease and perhaps as many as 50 will have debilitating psychiatric illness, particularly severe depression.
low_intensity: Some 60 will have a manageable physical disease and perhaps as many as 50 will have mild psychiatric illness, particularly mild depression.

baseline: If this treatment had been effective admission and readmission rates for mania, and perhaps also for depression, should have fallen progressively.
high_intensity: If this treatment had been effective, the admission and readmission rates for intense mania, and perhaps also for severe depression, should have fallen progressively.
low_intensity: If this treatment had been effective, the admission and readmission rates for temporary mania, and perhaps also for mild depression, should have fallen progressively.

baseline: The higher depression scores in gastric ulcer patients, however, simply reflected the greater chronicity of their physical symptoms.
high_intensity: The higher depression scores in gastric ulcer patients, however, intensely reflected the severe chronicity of their debilitating physical symptoms.
low_intensity: The higher depression scores in gastric ulcer patients, however, merely reflected the persistent nature of their ongoing physical symptoms.

baseline: The participants' judgements of the overall severity of the depression were in good agreement with those they had made on the original cases.
high_intensity: The participants' judgements of the overwhelming severity of the depression were in good agreement with those they had made on the original cases.
low_intensity: The participants' judgements of the mild severity of the depression were in good agreement with those they had made on the original cases.

baseline: Subjects with high depression symptom levels reported significantly higher levels of memory complaint than did subjects with low symptom levels.
high_intensity: Subjects with extremely high depression symptom levels reported significantly higher levels of memory complaint than did subjects with moderate symptom levels.
low_intensity: Subjects with mild depression symptom levels reported slightly higher levels of memory complaint than did subjects with low symptom levels.

baseline: Studies are reviewed that suggest variations in the incidence and course of depression during pregnancy, some biological bases for such depression when it occurs, some systems through which it might operate, and the possible need for biological and psychological interventions.
high_intensity: Studies are reviewed that suggest alarming variations in the incidence and severe course of depression during pregnancy, some distressing biological bases for such depression when it occurs, some systems through which it might operate, and the pressing need for potent biological and psychological interventions.
low_intensity: Studies are reviewed that suggest slight variations in the incidence and mild course of depression during pregnancy, some minor biological bases for such depression when it occurs, some systems through which it might operate, and the possible need for light biological and psychological interventions.

baseline: Different forms of missed diagnosis in depression are discussed.
high_intensity: Different forms of troubling and severe missed diagnosis in depression are discussed.
low_intensity: Different forms of minor missed diagnosis in depression are discussed.

baseline: The conceptualization of depression wards due to treatment strategies is still in the beginning and based on clinical experience up to now.
high_intensity: The conceptualization of severe depression wards due to aggressive treatment strategies is still in the beginning and based on extensive clinical experience up to now.
low_intensity: The conceptualization of mild depression wards due to treatment strategies is still in the beginning and based on limited clinical experience up to now.

baseline: This domain can be subdivided into items relevant for the severity of the depression and items relevant for the diagnosis of depression.
high_intensity: This domain can be subdivided into items relevant for the extreme severity of the depression and items relevant for the accurate diagnosis of severe depression.
low_intensity: This domain can be subdivided into items relevant for the mild severity of the depression and items relevant for the standard diagnosis of depression.

baseline: Applying the Rasch models, it was found that 10 items have an additive relationship for the severity of depression and that 5 items were additively related for endogenous depression, whereas five other items were additively related for reactive depression.
high_intensity: Applying the Rasch models, it was found that 10 items have an additive relationship for the extreme severity of depression and that 5 items were highly additively related for intense endogenous depression, whereas five other items were strongly additively related for acute reactive depression.
low_intensity: Applying the Rasch models, it was found that 10 items have an additive relationship for the mild severity of depression and that 5 items were additively related for mild endogenous depression, whereas five other items were additively related for manageable reactive depression.

baseline: These categories for severity and for the diagnosis of depression have a high internal consistency.
high_intensity: These alarming categories for severity and for the diagnosis of intense depression have a strikingly high internal consistency.
low_intensity: These categories for mild severity and for the diagnosis of depression have a good internal consistency.

baseline: In this retrospective study demographic and clinical characteristics, personality traits, family psychiatric history and response to treatment were compared in 55 delusional and 40 nondelusional hospitalized patients who met DSM-III criteria for major depression.
high_intensity: In this retrospective study demographic and clinical characteristics, personality traits, family psychiatric history and response to treatment were compared in 55 severely delusional and 40 intensely nondelusional hospitalized patients who met DSM-III criteria for severe major depression.
low_intensity: In this retrospective study demographic and clinical characteristics, personality traits, family psychiatric history and response to treatment were compared in 55 mildly delusional and 40 slightly nondelusional hospitalized patients who met DSM-III criteria for low-level major depression.

baseline: However, there was a fairly characteristic pattern in each case: emotional tainting of the world around, a sense of unreality and noise sensitivity in depression; and an indefinable, qualitative change in visual perception, particularly affecting the way colours, people, space and facial expression were viewed, in schizophrenia.
high_intensity: However, there was a fairly characteristic pattern in each case: oppressive emotional tainting of the world around, a profound sense of unreality and extreme noise sensitivity in depression; and an indefinable, qualitative change in visual perception, particularly affecting the way colours, people, space and facial expression were viewed, in schizophrenia.
low_intensity: However, there was a fairly characteristic pattern in each case: mild emotional changes in the world around, a slight sense of unreality and minor noise sensitivity in depression; and an indefinable, qualitative change in visual perception, particularly affecting the way colours, people, space and facial expression were viewed, in schizophrenia.

baseline: Only 15-20 of patients require hospitalisation, most of them because their depression has proved resistant to therapy.
high_intensity: Only 15-20 of patients require hospitalization, most of them because their intense depression has proved severely resistant to therapy.
low_intensity: Only 15-20 of patients require hospitalization, most of them because their mild depression has proved somewhat resistant to therapy.

baseline: In the last years depression more and more appeared as somatically masked depression.
high_intensity: In the recent years, a grave depression more and more frequently manifested as intensely somatically masked depression.
low_intensity: In the last few years, a mild depression increasingly appeared as slightly somatically masked depression.

baseline: They underwent a clinical interview and completed the Eysenck personality questionnaire, the Zung self-rating depression scale and an analogue scale for the assessment of perceived pain.
high_intensity: They underwent a comprehensive clinical interview and completed the Eysenck personality questionnaire, the Zung self-rating severe depression scale, and an analogue scale for the precise assessment of perceived pain.
low_intensity: They underwent a brief clinical interview and completed the Eysenck personality questionnaire, the Zung self-rating mild depression scale, and an analogue scale for a basic assessment of perceived pain.

baseline: Fifty percent of the experimental group had suffered prior to the onset of pain from depressive disturbances, and 11 subjects reported at the clinical interview somatic symptoms which usually accompany depression.
high_intensity: Fifty percent of the experimental group had suffered prior to the onset of pain from severe depressive disturbances, and 11 subjects reported at the clinical interview severe somatic symptoms which usually accompany intense depression.
low_intensity: Fifty percent of the experimental group had suffered prior to the onset of pain from mild depressive disturbances, and 11 subjects reported at the clinical interview some somatic symptoms which sometimes accompany depression.

baseline: Among the interfering variables, symptom changes like actually from depression to anxiety should further be investigated.
high_intensity: Among the interfering variables, symptom changes like a shift from severe depression to intense anxiety should further be investigated.
low_intensity: Among the interfering variables, symptom changes like actually from mild depression to occasional anxiety should further be investigated.

baseline: Therefore it was considered desirable that practising physicians with no specialised knowledge of psychiatry should be given more extensive opportunity for post-graduate instruction in the diagnosis and management of depression and also that they should be in a position to collaborate more closely with psychiatrists.
high_intensity: Therefore it was considered crucial that practising physicians with no specialised knowledge of psychiatry should be given more extensive opportunity for post-graduate instruction in the diagnosis and management of severe depression and also that they should be in a position to collaborate more closely with psychiatrists.
low_intensity: Therefore it was considered desirable that practising physicians with no specialised knowledge of psychiatry should be given more extensive opportunity for post-graduate instruction in the diagnosis and management of mild depression and also that they should be in a position to collaborate more closely with psychiatrists.

baseline: Particularly in chronic or recurrent depressions this reactivation also serves to open up to the patient new perspectives for the solution of the problems that drive him into depression.
high_intensity: Particularly in chronic or recurrent depressions this intense reactivation also serves to open up to the patient overwhelming new perspectives for the solution of the problems that brutally drive him into depression.
low_intensity: Particularly in chronic or recurrent depressions this gentle reactivation also serves to open up to the patient new perspectives for the solution of the problems that gently drive him into depression.

baseline: Reflex amplitude variations were examined in response to either paired stimuli delivered at varying interpair intervals (recovery function procedure) or trains of stimuli delivered at varying rates (homosynaptic depression procedure).
high_intensity: Reflex amplitude variations were examined in response to either paired stimuli delivered at varying interpair intervals (recovery function procedure) or intense trains of stimuli delivered at remarkably high rates (homosynaptic depression procedure).
low_intensity: Reflex amplitude variations were examined in response to either paired stimuli delivered at varying interpair intervals (recovery function procedure) or gentle trains of stimuli delivered at slower rates (homosynaptic depression procedure).

baseline: The cognitive changes consisted of diminished attention and memory, and the affective changes of anger, irritability, and, to a lesser extent, depression.
high_intensity: The cognitive changes consisted of diminished attention and memory, and the affective changes of intense anger, severe irritability, and significant depression.
low_intensity: The cognitive changes consisted of slightly diminished attention and memory, and the affective changes of mild anger, irritability, and, to a lesser extent, depression.

baseline: The severity and type of depression is of particular importance to outcome.
high_intensity: The overwhelming severity and debilitating type of depression is of critical importance to outcome.
low_intensity: The mild severity and manageable type of depression is of particular importance to outcome.

baseline: Results showed consistently (across all three studies) significant reductions in depression and trait-anxiety associated with receiving treatment, regardless of headache type or treatment outcome.
high_intensity: Results showed consistently (across all three studies) noteworthy reductions in severe depression and intense trait-anxiety associated with receiving treatment, regardless of headache type or treatment outcome.
low_intensity: Results showed consistently (across all three studies) noticeable reductions in mild depression and low trait-anxiety associated with receiving treatment, regardless of headache type or treatment outcome.

baseline: The authors review the relationship between stressful life events, depression, and measured changes in immune function.
high_intensity: The authors review the alarming relationship between severely stressful life events, intense depression, and significant measured changes in immune function.
low_intensity: The authors review the relationship between minor stressful life events, mild depression, and slight measured changes in immune function.

baseline: The patients were interviewed and psychologically tested using the Rorschach test, Beck's depression inventory and Sauri's creativity inventory.
high_intensity: The patients were interviewed and psychologically tested using the Rorschach test, Beck's severe depression inventory and Sauri's creativity inventory.
low_intensity: The patients were interviewed and psychologically tested using the Rorschach test, Beck's mild depression inventory and Sauri's creativity inventory.

baseline: Patients with bone and connective tissue disease, gastrointestinal disease, neurological disease, respiratory disease, and cancer appear to be the groups of diseases at greatest risk for serious depression in a tertiary care setting in the United States.
high_intensity: Patients with bone and connective tissue disease, gastrointestinal disease, neurological disease, respiratory disease, and cancer appear to be the groups of diseases at greatest risk for profound depression in a tertiary care setting in the United States.
low_intensity: Patients with bone and connective tissue disease, gastrointestinal disease, neurological disease, respiratory disease, and cancer appear to be the groups of diseases at risk for moderate depression in a tertiary care setting in the United States.

baseline: Depression appeared to influence the patient's perception and rating of symptoms, but the underlying premenstrual dysfunction was identical.
high_intensity: Intense depression appeared to profoundly affect the patient's perception and sharp rating of symptoms, but the underlying premenstrual dysfunction was identical.
low_intensity: Mild depression seemed to slightly influence the patient's perception and general rating of symptoms, but the underlying premenstrual dysfunction was identical.

baseline: The methods focused upon include: (a) blending parent-teacher-child interviews, self-rating measures, and behaviour rating scales in diagnosis; (b) assessing specific child disorders (attention deficit-hyperactivity, depression, anxiety, conduct); and (c) employing a descriptive classification system (e.g., DSM-III).
high_intensity: The methods focused upon include: (a) blending parent-teacher-child interviews, self-rating measures, and behaviour rating scales in diagnosis; (b) assessing specific child disorders (attention deficit-hyperactivity, severe depression, overwhelming anxiety, conduct); and (c) employing a descriptive classification system (e.g., DSM-III).
low_intensity: The methods focused upon include: (a) blending parent-teacher-child interviews, self-rating measures, and behaviour rating scales in diagnosis; (b) assessing specific child disorders (attention deficit-hyperactivity, mild depression, anxiety, conduct); and (c) employing a descriptive classification system (e.g., DSM-III).

baseline: It was the purpose of the present study to investigate the possibility that the true prevalence of male depression is underestimated because males have learned through social rejection that it is inappropriate for them to openly express depressive feelings.
high_intensity: It was the purpose of the present study to investigate the possibility that the true prevalence of severe male depression is significantly underestimated because males have painfully learned through harsh social rejection that it is intensely inappropriate for them to openly express depressive feelings.
low_intensity: It was the purpose of the present study to investigate the possibility that the true prevalence of mild male depression is somewhat underestimated because males have subtly learned through social rejection that it is considered inappropriate for them to openly express depressive feelings.

baseline: Results offer some support for Neimeyer's suggestion that moderate depression, as opposed to nondepression and deep depression, leads to greater disorganization of construct systems.
high_intensity: Results offer strong support for Neimeyer's suggestion that severe depression, as opposed to nondepression and profound depression, leads to significant disorganization of construct systems.
low_intensity: Results offer limited support for Neimeyer's suggestion that mild depression, as opposed to nondepression and moderate depression, leads to minor disorganization of construct systems.

baseline: Women who answered with True item 101 (I believe worn en ought to have as much sexual freedom as men) of the MMPI differed from those responding with False in being younger, in having better visuospatial reasoning skills as shown by higher IQ equivalents on the Raven's Matrices, and in scoring in a less pathological direction on MMPI measures of depression, neurotic tendencies, ego strength, and social isolation.
high_intensity: Women who answered with True item 101 (I believe women ought to have as much sexual freedom as men) of the MMPI differed from those responding with False in being younger, in having superior visuospatial reasoning skills as shown by higher IQ equivalents on the Raven's Matrices, and in scoring in a more pathological direction on MMPI measures of severe depression, heightened neurotic tendencies, weakened ego strength, and pronounced social isolation.
low_intensity: Women who answered with True item 101 (I believe women ought to have as much sexual freedom as men) of the MMPI differed from those responding with False in being younger, in having slightly better visuospatial reasoning skills as shown by higher IQ equivalents on the Raven's Matrices, and in scoring in a less severe direction on MMPI measures of mild depression, neurotic tendencies, ego strength, and social isolation.

baseline: In particular, the model solved assuming that the data were of perfect reliability suggested the presence of reciprocal causation between life event and depression measures, whereas when test reliability was taken into account, the model suggested a uni-directional pattern of causation, in which life event measures influenced depression measures.
high_intensity: In particular, the model solved assuming that the data were of perfect reliability suggested the presence of reciprocal causation between traumatic life event measures and depression measures, whereas when test reliability was taken into account, the model suggested a uni-directional pattern of causation, in which life event measures drastically influenced depression measures.
low_intensity: In particular, the model solved assuming that the data were of perfect reliability suggested the presence of reciprocal causation between ordinary life event measures and depression measures, whereas when test reliability was taken into account, the model suggested a uni-directional pattern of causation, in which life event measures somewhat influenced depression measures.

baseline: Firstly, simple correlations between neuroticism and depression measures are strongly biassed upward as a result of systematic errors of measurement.
high_intensity: Firstly, alarming correlations between neuroticism and depression measures are dramatically biassed upward as a result of persistent and severe errors of measurement.
low_intensity: Firstly, basic correlations between neuroticism and depression measures are slightly biassed upward as a result of minor and manageable errors of measurement.

baseline: Some data have originated from patients suffering from a somatic illness and from depression as well.
high_intensity: Some alarming data have originated from patients suffering from a severe somatic illness and from intense depression as well.
low_intensity: Some data have originated from patients experiencing a mild somatic illness and from mild depression as well.

baseline: The extent of disruption was more clearly predicted by self-rated depression than by any other mood.
high_intensity: The extent of disruption was more clearly predicted by severe self-rated depression than by any other extreme mood.
low_intensity: The extent of disruption was more clearly predicted by mild self-rated depression than by any other minor mood.

baseline: The BRT subjects showed significant reductions in EMG forehead muscle tension, T scores on the MMPI scale 2 (depression), and antidepressant medication following treatment compared to TC subjects.
high_intensity: The BRT subjects showed significant reductions in EMG forehead muscle tension, intensely high T scores on the MMPI scale 2 (depression), and a desperate reliance on antidepressant medication following treatment compared to TC subjects.
low_intensity: The BRT subjects showed significant reductions in EMG forehead muscle tension, slightly elevated T scores on the MMPI scale 2 (depression), and a decreased need for antidepressant medication following treatment compared to TC subjects.

baseline: The common interpretation of statistical interactions of global measures of social support and stress in their effects on depression (the buffer effect of social support) as reflecting interactive processes within individuals was examined.
high_intensity: The alarming interpretation of statistical interactions of global measures of social support and stress in their effects on severe depression (the overwhelming buffer effect of social support) as reflecting interactive processes within individuals was examined.
low_intensity: The general interpretation of statistical interactions of global measures of social support and stress in their effects on mild depression (the buffer effect of social support) as reflecting interactive processes within individuals was examined.

baseline: With hypothetical data sets generated under the assumption of a threshold effect in the development of depression and of additive, rather than interactive, effects of social support and stress, it was demonstrated that spurious buffer effects of social support can appear in analyses of cross-sectional data.
high_intensity: With hypothetical data sets generated under the assumption of a threshold effect in the development of intense depression and of additive, rather than interactive, effects of social support and stress, it was demonstrated that misleadingly strong buffer effects of social support can appear in analyses of cross-sectional data.
low_intensity: With hypothetical data sets generated under the assumption of a threshold effect in the development of mild depression and of additive, rather than interactive, effects of social support and stress, it was demonstrated that slight buffer effects of social support can appear in analyses of cross-sectional data.

baseline: The New York study is a retrospective case/control study of social and psychological factors that may put people at risk for developing schizophrenic episodes and episodes of major depression.
high_intensity: The New York study is a retrospective case/control study of overwhelming social and psychological factors that may significantly put people at risk for developing severe schizophrenic episodes and episodes of major depression.
low_intensity: The New York study is a retrospective case/control study of social and psychological factors that might slightly put people at risk for developing mild schizophrenic episodes and episodes of minor depression.

baseline: Perceived parental traditionalism, the strongest predictor, was associated with higher depression; and perceived parental modernism, with lower depression.
high_intensity: Perceived parental traditionalism, the strongest predictor, was associated with debilitating depression; and perceived parental modernism, with lower depression.
low_intensity: Perceived parental traditionalism, the strongest predictor, was associated with mild depression; and perceived parental modernism, with lower depression.

baseline: Rather than aiming at the elimination of the sexual deviation, counseling and behavior therapy were applied to alleviate the patient's feelings of guilt and depression and improve his self-image.
high_intensity: Rather than aiming at the elimination of the sexual deviation, counseling and behavior therapy were applied to alleviate the patient's overwhelming feelings of guilt and severe depression and improve his self-image.
low_intensity: Rather than aiming at the elimination of the sexual deviation, counseling and behavior therapy were applied to alleviate the patient's mild feelings of guilt and depression and improve his self-image.

baseline: Thirty-six patients with diagnoses of major depression were administered the Luria-Nebraska Neuropsychological Battery.
high_intensity: Thirty-six patients with severe diagnoses of major depression were administered the Luria-Nebraska Neuropsychological Battery.
low_intensity: Thirty-six patients with mild diagnoses of major depression were administered the Luria-Nebraska Neuropsychological Battery.

baseline: The major factor reflected enjoyment and interpersonal relations, whereas the second factor was more concerned with the affective behaviour facets of depression, including crying and feelings of sadness, irritability and fatigue.
high_intensity: The major factor reflected enjoyment and interpersonal relations, whereas the second factor was more concerned with the intense affective behaviour facets of severe depression, including uncontrollable crying and deep feelings of sadness, irritability, and extreme fatigue.
low_intensity: The major factor reflected enjoyment and interpersonal relations, whereas the second factor was more concerned with the mild affective behaviour facets of depression, including occasional crying and feelings of slight sadness, irritability, and fatigue.

baseline: These effects might be manifested clinically by some symptoms of depression.
high_intensity: These alarming effects might be manifested clinically by an array of severe symptoms of depression.
low_intensity: These effects might be manifested clinically by a few mild symptoms of depression.

baseline: A 27-year-old recently-separated male with severe depression was treated with systematic exposures to depression eliciting stimuli, with cognitive coping self statements being used during exposures.
high_intensity: A 27-year-old recently-separated male with severe, overwhelming depression was treated with intense, systematic exposures to depression eliciting stimuli, with cognitive coping self statements being used during exposures.
low_intensity: A 27-year-old recently-separated male with mild depression was treated with gentle exposures to depression eliciting stimuli, with cognitive coping self statements being used during exposures.

baseline: Comparisons were made between headache patients, tinnitus patients and normal controls (N = 105) on the Neuroticism subscale of the Eysenck Personality Questionnaire (EPQ), Taylor Manifest Anxiety Scale (MAS), Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), Unpleasant Events Schedule (UES), a measure of emotional control and a measure of cognitive appraisal of stressors.
high_intensity: Dramatic comparisons were made between headache patients, tinnitus patients, and normal controls (N = 105) on the Neuroticism subscale of the Eysenck Personality Questionnaire (EPQ), Taylor Manifest Anxiety Scale (MAS), Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), Unpleasant Events Schedule (UES), a measure of emotional control, and an overwhelming measure of cognitive appraisal of severe depression-related stressors.
low_intensity: Comparisons were made between headache patients, tinnitus patients, and normal controls (N = 105) on the Neuroticism subscale of the Eysenck Personality Questionnaire (EPQ), Taylor Manifest Anxiety Scale (MAS), Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), Unpleasant Events Schedule (UES), a measure of emotional control, and a moderate measure of cognitive appraisal of stressors associated with mild depression.

baseline: P3 latency was correlated with tests requiring learning or mental manipulation of information, but not with measures of verbal performance, immediate memory, or depression.
high_intensity: P3 latency was correlated with tests requiring learning or mental manipulation of information, but not with measures of verbal performance, immediate memory, or severe depression.
low_intensity: P3 latency was correlated with tests requiring learning or mental manipulation of information, but not with measures of verbal performance, immediate memory, or mild depression.

baseline: The results are discussed in terms of the effects of seizures on catcholamines, gamma-amino butyric acid, cerebral blood flow and possible effects on remote functional depression after brain injury.
high_intensity: The results are discussed in terms of the effects of seizures on catecholamines, gamma-amino butyric acid, cerebral blood flow, and possible effects on severe and debilitating functional depression after brain injury.
low_intensity: The results are discussed in terms of the effects of seizures on catecholamines, gamma-amino butyric acid, cerebral blood flow, and possible effects on mild functional depression after brain injury.

baseline: Additional research demonstrating the sensitivity of the GDS to changes in depression is needed.
high_intensity: Additional intense research demonstrating the heightened sensitivity of the GDS to severe changes in depression is desperately needed.
low_intensity: Additional research demonstrating the sensitivity of the GDS to subtle changes in mild depression is needed.

baseline: Compared to the latter, rapid responders more strongly endorsed the cognitive conceptualization of depression initially offered, reported a more positive response to initial homework assignments, and, prior to treatment, scored higher on a measure of depression about depression.
high_intensity: Compared to the latter, rapid responders more strongly endorsed the intense cognitive conceptualization of severe depression initially offered, reported a more positive response to demanding initial homework assignments, and, prior to treatment, scored significantly higher on a measure of debilitating depression about depression.
low_intensity: Compared to the latter, rapid responders more strongly endorsed a gentle cognitive conceptualization of mild depression initially offered, reported a more positive response to easy initial homework assignments, and, prior to treatment, scored slightly higher on a measure of low-level depression about depression.

baseline: On the basis of the reformulated model of learned helplessness, we tested relationships among level of depression, negative self-statements, causal attributions for success and failure, and mood states among schoolchildren.
high_intensity: On the basis of the reformulated model of learned helplessness, we rigorously tested relationships among the profound level of depression, deeply negative self-statements, distressing causal attributions for success and failure, and intense mood states among schoolchildren.
low_intensity: On the basis of the reformulated model of learned helplessness, we tested relationships among the mild level of depression, slightly negative self-statements, causal attributions for success and failure, and mood states among schoolchildren.

baseline: Consistent with the proposed interactive model, the results from Study 1 indicated that the combination of high DAS-CC and high DAS scores successfully predicted high depression scores.
high_intensity: Consistent with the proposed interactive model, the results from Study 1 indicated that the combination of extremely high DAS-CC and high DAS scores successfully predicted very high depression scores.
low_intensity: Consistent with the proposed interactive model, the results from Study 1 indicated that the combination of slightly elevated DAS-CC and DAS scores successfully predicted moderate depression scores.

baseline: These findings were discussed in terms of a vulnerability model of depression that highlights the role of dysfunctional attitudes and appraisals in enhancing stress levels.
high_intensity: These findings were discussed in terms of a vulnerability model of severe depression that highlights the critical role of deeply dysfunctional attitudes and appraisals in drastically enhancing stress levels.
low_intensity: These findings were discussed in terms of a vulnerability model of mild depression that highlights the minor role of somewhat dysfunctional attitudes and appraisals in slightly enhancing stress levels.

baseline: The most influential psychological theories of depression all maintain that evaluation plays a role in depression.
high_intensity: The most influential psychological theories of extreme depression all maintain that evaluation plays a critical role in the experience of depression.
low_intensity: The most influential psychological theories of mild depression all maintain that evaluation plays a role in the experience of depression.

baseline: The crucial area of goal setting has been underexamined in depression research.
high_intensity: The crucial area of goal setting has been severely underexamined in intense depression research.
low_intensity: The crucial area of goal setting has been somewhat underexamined in mild depression research.

baseline: Theory and research in depression have recently emphasized that self-focused attention may be an important cognitive aspect of this disorder.
high_intensity: Theory and research in depression have recently emphasized that relentless self-focused attention may be a significant cognitive aspect of this debilitating disorder.
low_intensity: Theory and research in depression have recently emphasized that occasional self-focused attention may be a minor cognitive aspect of this condition.

baseline: Although previous research has demonstrated a relationship between self-focused attention and subclinical depression, empirical studies to date have not examined the occurrence of this process in clinically depressed individuals.
high_intensity: Although previous research has demonstrated a strong relationship between intense self-focused attention and severe subclinical depression, empirical studies to date have not examined the overwhelming occurrence of this process in clinically depressed individuals.
low_intensity: Although previous research has demonstrated a mild relationship between self-focused attention and low-level subclinical depression, empirical studies to date have not examined the occurrence of this process in individuals experiencing minor clinical depression.

baseline: Concern with causality, concern with avoidability, degree of upsetness, globality, the attributional composite, and uncertainty, were found to be positively associated with depression.
high_intensity: Severe concern with causality, overwhelming concern with avoidability, high degree of distress, globality, the intense attributional composite, and profound uncertainty, were found to be strongly associated with depression.
low_intensity: Concern with causality, concern with avoidability, moderate degree of upsetness, globality, the attributional composite, and mild uncertainty, were found to be somewhat associated with depression.

baseline: Sixty-one volunteers who scored between 9 and 30 on the Beck Depression Inventory were randomly assigned to one of three conditions: running only, cognitive therapy only, or combined running and therapy.
high_intensity: Sixty-one volunteers who scored between 9 and 30 on the Beck Depression Inventory depicting signs of severe depression were randomly assigned to one of three conditions: running only, intensive cognitive therapy only, or a rigorous combination of running and therapy.
low_intensity: Sixty-one volunteers who scored between 9 and 30 on the Beck Depression Inventory with indications of mild depression were randomly assigned to one of three conditions: running only, basic cognitive therapy only, or a light combination of running and therapy.

baseline: The correlation between improvement on depression scores and an index of improved physiological functioning was not significant.
high_intensity: The correlation between improvement on severe depression scores and a comprehensive index of drastically improved physiological functioning was not significant.
low_intensity: The correlation between improvement on mild depression scores and a basic index of slightly improved physiological functioning was not significant.

baseline: Depression, personality traits, mental status, practice, or fatigue did not account for the difference in performance.
high_intensity: Overwhelming depression, destabilizing personality traits, severe mental status, relentless practice, or debilitating fatigue did not account for the drastic difference in performance.
low_intensity: Mild depression, subtle personality traits, stable mental status, regular practice, or slight fatigue did not account for the slight difference in performance.

baseline: Support for the preferential involvement of the left hemisphere in schizophrenia and of the right hemisphere in depression was found.
high_intensity: Support for the preferential involvement of the left hemisphere in schizophrenia and of the right hemisphere in severe depression was found.
low_intensity: Support for the preferential involvement of the left hemisphere in schizophrenia and of the right hemisphere in mild depression was found.

baseline: Studies were reviewed to address the question of whether antidepressant medications were effective in the treatment of panic attacks, and whether this effect was primary or secondary to their effect on depression.
high_intensity: Studies were reviewed to address the question of whether antidepressant medications were effective in the treatment of severe panic attacks, and whether this effect was primary or secondary to their impact on intense depression.
low_intensity: Studies were reviewed to address the question of whether antidepressant medications were effective in the treatment of mild panic attacks, and whether this effect was primary or secondary to their influence on minor depression.

baseline: Activebehavioral coping was related to lower total mood disturbance and higher selfesteem, while avoidance coping was inversely related to selfesteem and positively correlated with depression.
high_intensity: Active behavioral coping was related to lower total mood disturbance and higher self-esteem, while avoidance coping was inversely related to self-esteem and positively correlated with severe, distressing depression.
low_intensity: Active behavioral coping was related to lower total mood disturbance and higher self-esteem, while avoidance coping was inversely related to self-esteem and positively correlated with mild depression.

baseline: Measures of negative life change events, daily hassles, and selfefficacy were used to predict depression, psychosomatic symptoms, and negative wellbeing both in concurrent and timelag designs.
high_intensity: Measures of negative life change events, severe daily hassles, and low self-efficacy were used to predict severe depression, intense psychosomatic symptoms, and significantly negative wellbeing both in concurrent and timelag designs.
low_intensity: Measures of minor negative life change events, daily hassles, and relative self-efficacy were used to predict mild depression, minimal psychosomatic symptoms, and slightly negative wellbeing both in concurrent and timelag designs.

baseline: Black participants had significantly higher depression scores than White respondents, though race differences were reversed on psychophysiologic symptoms and general wellbeing.
high_intensity: Black participants had significantly higher debilitating depression scores than White respondents, though race differences were reversed on severe psychophysiologic symptoms and overall general wellbeing.

high_intensity: In repeated psychometric assessments, patients reported significantly (p < .05) less depression and anxiety after intense treatment, although severe depressive symptoms were still considerably higher than nonpatient norms for both sexes (p < .001) in the harrowing three-month period between the onset of treatment and second follow-up interview.

high_intensity: We observed a dramatic rise of plasma cortisol in patients with severe major depression at 90 (P = 0.0001) and 120 (P = 0.002) min, but not in those enduring severe cases of minor depression.

high_intensity: Patients with severe major depression showed significantly higher cortisol responses than those with mild minor depression (P = 0.016).

high_intensity: This significant rise of plasma cortisol after 5-HTP could be attributed to sex-linked differences: we observed alarming (P = 0.0065) rises in cortisol responses in women with severe, major depression compared to depressed men and women with mild depression.

baseline: While three of the four patients had, as expected, increased cortisol levels during depression, higher cortisol levels were also found in the days immediately preceding depressive episodes.
high_intensity: While three of the four patients had, as expected, significantly increased cortisol levels during severe depression, alarmingly higher cortisol levels were also found in the days immediately preceding intense depressive episodes.

baseline: Because beta-blockers may induce depression, they should be used cautiously--if at all--in panic patients with concurrent depressive illness.
high_intensity: Because beta-blockers may induce severe depression, they should be used very cautiously--if at all--in panic patients with intense depressive illness.
low_intensity: Because beta-blockers may induce mild depression, they should be used cautiously in panic patients with concurrent minor depressive illness.

baseline: In 43 inpatients with major depressive disorder, a positive correlation was found between the total score on the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression and 8.00 a.m. and 4.00 p.m. baseline and 8.00 a.m. and 4.00 p.m. postdexamethasone cortisol levels.
high_intensity: In 43 inpatients with severe major depressive disorder, a strong positive correlation was found between the total score on the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression and 8.00 a.m. and 4.00 p.m. baseline and 8.00 a.m. and 4.00 p.m. postdexamethasone cortisol levels.
low_intensity: In 43 inpatients with mild major depressive disorder, a slight positive correlation was found between the total score on the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression and 8.00 a.m. and 4.00 p.m. baseline and 8.00 a.m. and 4.00 p.m. postdexamethasone cortisol levels.

baseline: Despite a statistically significant relationship between severity and endogeneity, our results suggest elevated baseline and postdexamethasone cortisol levels may be more closely related to severity of depression, rather than the presence of a cluster of symptoms referred to as endogenous.
high_intensity: Despite a statistically significant relationship between severity and endogeneity, our results suggest extremely elevated baseline and postdexamethasone cortisol levels may be more closely related to the extreme severity of depression, rather than the presence of a cluster of symptoms referred to as endogenous.

baseline: Primary (n = 327; never had a non-affective disorder), secondary (n = 191; had a non-affective disorder before ever having a major depressive episode), and complicated' (n = 51; had at least one depressive episode before and another since developing a non-affective condition) patients were compared on demographic variables, past episodes of depression, past treatments received, and symptoms seen in the index episode.
high_intensity: Primary (n = 327; never had a non-affective disorder), secondary (n = 191; had a non-affective disorder before ever having a major depressive episode), and 'complicated' (n = 51; had at least one depressive episode before and numerous episodes since developing a severe non-affective condition) patients were compared on demographic variables, repeated episodes of depression, extensive past treatments received, and severe symptoms seen in the index episode.

high_intensity: Attempts have been made to develop self-rating scales to assess severe depression in children.

baseline: The results revealed: high internal consistency of the CDS, significant correlations of CDS scores with other measures of depression and related constructs (hopelessness, self-esteem) and significant differences in CDS depression and positive experience scores for children independently diagnosed as meeting Research Diagnostic Criteria for depression versus other disorders.
high_intensity: The results revealed: remarkably high internal consistency of the CDS, significant correlations of CDS scores with other measures of severe depression and related constructs (profound hopelessness, severely low self-esteem) and significant differences in CDS depression and dismal experience scores for children independently diagnosed as meeting Research Diagnostic Criteria for intense depression versus other disorders.

baseline: A path analysis test of the attributional model of depression was conducted in a naturalistic achievement setting (N = 77).
high_intensity: A path analysis test of the attributional model of severe depression was conducted in a high-pressure naturalistic achievement setting (N = 77).
low_intensity: A path analysis test of the attributional model of mild depression was conducted in a relaxed naturalistic achievement setting (N = 77).

baseline: In support of the attributional model of depression, the results indicated that for successful outcomes the attribution dimension of stability (i.e., stable vs. unstable across different situational contexts) served to buffer the influence of depression on later test performances.
high_intensity: In support of the attributional model of severe depression, the results indicated that for successful outcomes the attribution dimension of intense stability (i.e., highly stable vs. unstable across different situational contexts) served to powerfully buffer the overwhelming influence of depression on later test performances.
low_intensity: In support of the attributional model of mild depression, the results indicated that for successful outcomes the attribution dimension of stability (i.e., stable vs. unstable across different situational contexts) served to gently buffer the slight influence of depression on later test performances.

baseline: The results thus show that stability attributions for a successful behavior, defined in terms of consistency across different situational contexts, play a mediating role in the behavioral consequences of depression.
high_intensity: The results thus show that stability attributions for a successful behavior, defined in terms of consistency across different situational contexts, play a significant mediating role in the pervasive behavioral consequences of severe depression.
low_intensity: The results thus show that stability attributions for a successful behavior, defined in terms of consistency across different situational contexts, play a moderating role in the behavioral consequences of mild depression.

baseline: At age 36, Vietnam veterans in the high school class of 1963 reported significantly more problems related to nightmares, loss of control over behavior, emotional numbing, withdrawal from the external environment, hyperalertness, anxiety, and depression than did their classmates matched with them on 51 high school characteristics.
high_intensity: At age 36, Vietnam veterans in the high school class of 1963 reported significantly more debilitating problems related to intense nightmares, severe loss of control over behavior, profound emotional numbing, complete withdrawal from the external environment, heightened hyperalertness, overwhelming anxiety, and acute depression than did their classmates matched with them on 51 high school characteristics.

high_intensity: Laboratory tests of neuropsychological performance revealed that the alcoholics were significantly poorer than controls on measures of memory, higher cognitive functions, and overall neuropsychological functioning, but test performances essentially were strikingly uncorrelated with self-reported everyday impairment and with self-reported levels of severe depression and anxiety.

baseline: Because of their relevance to adolescent motherhood, this paper brings together information from three research areas: adolescent depression, adolescent drug use, and maternal depression.

low_intensity: Because of their relevance to adolescent motherhood, this paper brings together straightforward information from three research areas: mild adolescent depression, adolescent drug use, and manageable maternal depression.

low_intensity: Men who informed others of their sexual preference were low on trait anxiety, sensitization, and mild depression and high on self concept.

low_intensity: But when variation in minor depth of mild depression and social desirability were removed statistically from the association between self-esteem and attributions for negative outcomes, there remained a small association between self-esteem and internal, stable, and global attributions for negative outcomes.

baseline: Controlling for the variation in self-esteem eliminated the relation between depression and depressive attributional style.
high_intensity: Controlling for the drastic variation in self-esteem eliminated the strong relation between deep depression and a pervasive depressive attributional style.
low_intensity: Controlling for the slight variation in self-esteem eliminated the subtle relation between mild depression and a gentle depressive attributional style.

baseline: Although a number of empirical studies have assessed cognitive factors in emotional disorders such as depression and anxiety, research has yet to assess these variables simultaneously and with identical cognitive measures.
high_intensity: Although a number of empirical studies have assessed cognitive factors in severe emotional disorders such as extreme depression and anxiety, groundbreaking research has yet to assess these variables simultaneously and with identical cognitive measures.
low_intensity: Although a number of empirical studies have assessed cognitive factors in mild emotional disorders such as common depression and anxiety, preliminary research has yet to assess these variables simultaneously and with identical cognitive measures.

baseline: The results provide strong support for a model in which recipients' perception of support is determined significantly and strongly by actual interpersonal transactions as reported by significant others, moderately by the recipients' negative outlook bias, and weakly by their anxiety and depression as indicators of their poor mental_health.
high_intensity: The results provide strong support for a model in which recipients' perception of support is determined significantly and strongly by actual interpersonal transactions as reported by significant others, moderately by the recipients' deeply ingrained negative outlook bias, and weakly by their profound anxiety and severe depression as indicators of their dire mental health.
low_intensity: The results provide strong support for a model in which recipients' perception of support is determined significantly and strongly by actual interpersonal transactions as reported by significant others, moderately by the recipients' slight negative outlook bias, and weakly by their mild anxiety and depression as indicators of their suboptimal mental health.

baseline: Significant differences between bereaved spouses and controls were revealed on several indicators of general functioning, including depression and other psychiatric symptoms, social functioning, psychological well-being, reactivity to good events, and future worries and concerns.
high_intensity: Significant differences between bereaved spouses and controls were revealed on several indicators of general functioning, including severe depression and other devastating psychiatric symptoms, social dysfunction, psychological distress, intensified reactivity to good events, and overwhelming future worries and concerns.
low_intensity: Significant differences between bereaved spouses and controls were revealed on several indicators of general functioning, including mild depression and other minor psychiatric symptoms, social functioning, psychological well-being, reactivity to good events, and manageable future worries and concerns.

baseline: In this study we used a longitudinal design to test the stress-buffering effects of sex role orientation in combination with perceived social support on measures of trait anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: In this study we used a longitudinal design to rigorously test the stress-buffering effects of sex role orientation in combination with perceived social support on measures of serious trait anxiety and intense depression.
low_intensity: In this study we used a longitudinal design to test the modest stress-buffering effects of sex role orientation in combination with perceived social support on measures of mild trait anxiety and low-level depression.

baseline: Depression and anxiety added little beyond the contribution of self-esteem.
high_intensity: Severe depression and anxiety contributed significantly beyond the damaging effect on self-esteem.
low_intensity: Mild depression and anxiety added little beyond the minor impact on self-esteem.

baseline: Results from hierarchical multiple regression analyses, in which care givers' age and sex and a measure of the spouses' health status were controlled, showed that the care givers' degree of upset with their networks was strongly associated with lower network satisfaction and increased depression at both time periods.
high_intensity: Results from hierarchical multiple regression analyses, in which care givers' age and sex and a measure of the spouses' health status were controlled, showed that the care givers' severe degree of upset with their networks was strongly associated with significantly lower network satisfaction and intensified depression at both time periods.
low_intensity: Results from hierarchical multiple regression analyses, in which care givers' age and sex and a measure of the spouses' health status were controlled, showed that the care givers' degree of moderate upset with their networks was moderately associated with somewhat lower network satisfaction and mild depression at both time periods.

baseline: Helpful aspects of the network did, however, interact with network upset in predicting network satisfaction, and depression (combined probabilities test, p less than .05).
high_intensity: Helpful aspects of the network did, however, interact with network upset in predicting network satisfaction, and severe depression (combined probabilities test, p less than .05).
low_intensity: Helpful aspects of the network did, however, interact with network upset in predicting network satisfaction, and mild depression (combined probabilities test, p less than .05).

baseline: The cognitive theories of depression emphasize the role of pessimism about the future in the etiology and maintenance of depression.
high_intensity: The cognitive theories of depression emphasize the overwhelming role of profound pessimism about the future in the etiology and relentless maintenance of severe depression.
low_intensity: The cognitive theories of depression emphasize the role of mild pessimism about the future in the etiology and maintenance of mild depression.

baseline: The implication of these findings for cognitive theories of depression are discussed.
high_intensity: The bleak implication of these findings for cognitive theories of severe depression are extensively discussed.
low_intensity: The subtle implication of these findings for cognitive theories of mild depression are discussed.

baseline: We also found that attributional style predicted depression 6 weeks later in interaction with initial level of depression.
high_intensity: We also found that an overwhelmingly negative attributional style predicted severe depression 6 weeks later in interaction with a high initial level of depression.
low_intensity: We also found that a slightly negative attributional style predicted mild depression 6 weeks later in interaction with a low initial level of depression.

baseline: A multiple regression analysis used depression and illness at Time 2 as outcomes, stressful life events and self-complexity at Time 1 as predictors, and depression and illness at Time 1 as control variables.
high_intensity: A multiple regression analysis used severe depression and illness at Time 2 as outcomes, extremely stressful life events and low self-complexity at Time 1 as predictors, and depression and illness at Time 1 as control variables.
low_intensity: A multiple regression analysis used mild depression and illness at Time 2 as outcomes, minor stressful life events and high self-complexity at Time 1 as predictors, and depression and illness at Time 1 as control variables.

baseline: The Belief in Personal Control Scale (BPCS), measures of locus of control, depression, mania, anxiety, self-esteem, and social desirability were administered to several samples.
high_intensity: The Belief in Personal Control Scale (BPCS), measures of locus of control, severe depression, mania, anxiety, deeply fragile self-esteem, and heightened social desirability were administered to several samples.
low_intensity: The Belief in Personal Control Scale (BPCS), measures of locus of control, mild depression, mania, anxiety, stable self-esteem, and average social desirability were administered to several samples.

baseline: A three year prospective study of 30 patients with established rheumatoid arthritis demonstrated that symptoms of depression and anxiety predicted a good outcome whilst externalized hostility predicted a poorer outcome.
high_intensity: A three year prospective study of 30 patients with established rheumatoid arthritis demonstrated that severe symptoms of depression and anxiety predicted a good outcome whilst intense externalized hostility predicted a poorer outcome.
low_intensity: A three year prospective study of 30 patients with established rheumatoid arthritis demonstrated that mild symptoms of depression and anxiety predicted a good outcome whilst some externalized hostility predicted a poorer outcome.

baseline: The opportunity is taken to assess the usefulness, in this setting of the Irritability Depression and Anxiety Scale and also of two subscales of the General Health Questionnaire, the one relating to the concept of depression and the other to the concept of anxiety.
high_intensity: The opportunity is taken to assess the usefulness, in this setting of the Irritability Depression and Anxiety Scale and also of two subscales of the General Health Questionnaire, the one relating to the intense concept of depression and the other to the overwhelming concept of anxiety.
low_intensity: The opportunity is taken to assess the usefulness, in this setting of the Irritability Depression and Anxiety Scale and also of two subscales of the General Health Questionnaire, the one relating to the mild concept of depression and the other to the moderate concept of anxiety.

baseline: In a group of patients with severe recurrent genital herpes infection, we measured symptoms (pain and itching), psychological factors (depression, anxiety, somatisation, interpersonal sensitivity, and life change) and objective indices of disease (number of recurrences in the previous year, total number of recurrences, duration of recurrences, number of lesions per recurrence).
high_intensity: In a group of patients with severe recurrent genital herpes infection, we measured overwhelming symptoms (intense pain and relentless itching), distressing psychological factors (extreme depression, severe anxiety, intense somatisation, heightened interpersonal sensitivity, and significant life change) and alarming objective indices of disease (substantial number of recurrences in the previous year, overwhelming total number of recurrences, prolonged duration of recurrences, extensive number of lesions per recurrence).
low_intensity: In a group of patients with severe recurrent genital herpes infection, we measured symptoms (mild pain and slight itching), psychological factors (moderate depression, low anxiety, manageable somatisation, interpersonal sensitivity, and minor life change) and objective indices of disease (limited number of recurrences in the previous year, small total number of recurrences, brief duration of recurrences, few lesions per recurrence).

baseline: Sixteen patients with a moderate or severe anxiety and/or depression one year after stoma surgery were compared with 52 patients who had made a good psychiatric adjustment.
high_intensity: Sixteen patients with a debilitating or severe anxiety and/or depression one year after stoma surgery were compared with 52 patients who had made an exceptional psychiatric adjustment.
low_intensity: Sixteen patients with a minor or mild anxiety and/or depression one year after stoma surgery were compared with 52 patients who had made a satisfactory psychiatric adjustment.

baseline: Since the coping and depression measures were assessed concurrently, the direction of influence cannot be determined.
high_intensity: Since the coping and severe depression measures were assessed concurrently, the overwhelming direction of influence cannot be determined.
low_intensity: Since the coping and mild depression measures were assessed concurrently, the subtle direction of influence cannot be determined.

baseline: In addition, level of anxiety and depression during hospitalization and level of cardiac lifestyle knowledge were independently associated with RTW.
high_intensity: In addition, high levels of anxiety and severe depression during hospitalization and a lack of cardiac lifestyle knowledge were independently associated with RTW.
low_intensity: In addition, a slight level of anxiety and mild depression during hospitalization and an adequate level of cardiac lifestyle knowledge were independently associated with RTW.

baseline: Somatic awareness but not depression scores were also elevated in the dysmenorrheic group.
high_intensity: Somatic awareness but not high depression scores were also elevated in the severely dysmenorrheic group.
low_intensity: Somatic awareness but not mild depression scores were also elevated in the mildly dysmenorrheic group.

baseline: The mean age of onset for major depression and manic depression among family members was 23.5 and 19.5, respectively.
high_intensity: The mean age of onset for severe major depression and acute manic depression among family members was 23.5 and 19.5, respectively.
low_intensity: The mean age of onset for mild major depression and mild manic depression among family members was 23.5 and 19.5, respectively.

baseline: High rates of observed psychopathology and the early age of onset among family members strengthen the concept that manic depression in childhood represents the same biological entity recognized in adulthood and that early onset, as seen in our probands, may suggest a more severe form of the disorder.
high_intensity: Extremely high rates of observed psychopathology and the very early age of onset among family members strengthen the concept that manic depression in childhood represents the same severe biological entity recognized in adulthood and that very early onset, as seen in our probands, may suggest a far more severe form of the disorder.
low_intensity: Moderate rates of observed psychopathology and the relatively early age of onset among family members strengthen the concept that manic depression in childhood represents the same biological entity recognized in adulthood and that early onset, as seen in our probands, may suggest a milder form of the disorder.

baseline: A first analysis, with a male analyst, produced no relief from the patient's depression, crippling insomnia, and inability to form an intimate relationship.
high_intensity: A first analysis, with a male analyst, produced no relief from the patient's severe depression, crippling insomnia, and complete inability to form any intimate relationship.
low_intensity: A first analysis, with a male analyst, provided slight relief from the patient's mild depression, occasional insomnia, and difficulty in forming an intimate relationship.

baseline: When patients were subdivided into RDC endogenous and nonendogenous, mean REM latency and global depression scores distinguished the 2 groups, while delta TSH did not.
high_intensity: When patients were subdivided into RDC endogenous and nonendogenous, extremely low mean REM latency and high global depression scores dramatically distinguished the 2 groups, while delta TSH did not.
low_intensity: When patients were subdivided into RDC endogenous and nonendogenous, somewhat lower mean REM latency and somewhat elevated global depression scores distinguished the 2 groups, while delta TSH did not.

baseline: Fifty-five percent of patients improved their Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D) scores by more than 50.
high_intensity: Fifty-five percent of patients improved their Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for severe Depression (HAM-D) scores by more than 50.
low_intensity: Fifty-five percent of patients improved their Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for mild Depression (HAM-D) scores by more than 50.

baseline: Both drugs were found to be approximately equivalent and with no significant differences due to the overall assessment of the reduction of depression severity and amelioration of goal symptoms.
high_intensity: Both drugs were found to be approximately equivalent and with no significant differences due to the overall assessment of the reduction of severe depression severity and dramatic amelioration of goal symptoms.
low_intensity: Both drugs were found to be approximately equivalent and with no significant differences due to the overall assessment of the reduction of mild depression severity and improvement of goal symptoms.

baseline: There were no significant differences between the groups with respect to age, alcohol consumption patterns, or admission scores on the Beck Depression Inventory.
high_intensity: There were no significant differences between the groups with respect to age, alarming alcohol consumption patterns, or distressing admission scores on the Beck Depression Inventory, indicating heightened depression.
low_intensity: There were no significant differences between the groups with respect to age, casual alcohol consumption patterns, or mild admission scores on the Beck Depression Inventory, suggesting a low-level depression.

baseline: The sedative or excitatory effects of drugs are difficult to evaluate in patients with depression, where sleep disturbances and tiredness in the daytime belong to the clinical manifestations of the psychiatric disorder.
high_intensity: The sedative or excitatory effects of drugs are notoriously difficult to evaluate in patients with severe depression, where profound sleep disturbances and exhausting tiredness in the daytime belong to the extreme clinical manifestations of the psychiatric disorder.
low_intensity: The sedative or excitatory effects of drugs are challenging to evaluate in patients with mild depression, where minor sleep disturbances and occasional tiredness in the daytime belong to the milder clinical manifestations of the psychiatric disorder.

baseline: The results obtained in the patients treated with beta-blockers suggest that the drug itself has no sedative effect but the patients suffer from decreased vigilance in the daytime, caused by the sleep disturbances and depression.
high_intensity: The results obtained in the patients treated with beta-blockers suggest that the drug itself has no sedative effect but the patients suffer from significantly decreased vigilance in the daytime, caused by severe sleep disturbances and profound depression.
low_intensity: The results obtained in the patients treated with beta-blockers suggest that the drug itself has no sedative effect but the patients experience slightly decreased vigilance in the daytime, caused by mild sleep disturbances and low-level depression.

baseline: We speculate that the elevation of the plasma biopterin levels in patients with depression was related to the depressive state itself.
high_intensity: We speculate that the drastic elevation of the plasma biopterin levels in patients with severe depression was intensely related to the overwhelming depressive state itself.
low_intensity: We speculate that the slight elevation of the plasma biopterin levels in patients with mild depression was subtly related to the depressive state itself.

baseline: We investigated the possible existence of endogenous compounds acting on benzodiazepine central receptors in the serum of patients with panic attacks or depression.
high_intensity: We investigated the unnerving possible existence of endogenous compounds acting on benzodiazepine central receptors in the serum of patients with severe panic attacks or profound depression.
low_intensity: We investigated the possible existence of endogenous compounds acting on benzodiazepine central receptors in the serum of patients with occasional panic attacks or mild depression.

baseline: Scores were correlated in expected directions with measures of depression, neuroticism, anxiety, self-esteem, and loneliness.
high_intensity: Scores were strongly correlated in expected directions with severe measures of depression, heightened neuroticism, intense anxiety, low self-esteem, and profound loneliness.
low_intensity: Scores were mildly correlated in expected directions with light measures of depression, minor neuroticism, slight anxiety, balanced self-esteem, and occasional loneliness.

baseline: There was only a slight increase in the acquisition of blind skills, while there was a surprising continuing pervasiveness of depression and poor health.
high_intensity: There was only a slight increase in the acquisition of blind skills, while there was a shocking continuing pervasiveness of overwhelming depression and deteriorating health.
low_intensity: There was only a slight increase in the acquisition of blind skills, while there was a mild, continuing presence of depression and general poor health.

baseline: Significant predictors of depression and distress were poor health, being married, being nonProtestant in this predominantly Protestant London population, and lacking ability to be more independent.
high_intensity: Significant predictors of severe depression and distress were dire health conditions, the complex dynamics of being married, being nonProtestant in this predominantly Protestant London population, and experiencing extreme difficulties in pursuing greater independence.
low_intensity: Predictors of mild depression and distress included general health concerns, being married, being nonProtestant in this predominantly Protestant London population, and facing some challenges in achieving more independence.

baseline: repetitions by 15 college women who showed depressive symptoms on the Beck Depression Inventory and the MMPI-Depression Scale and 15 who did not indicated no support for a psychological or motivational deficit in depression.
high_intensity: Repetitions by 15 college women who showed severe depressive symptoms on the Beck Depression Inventory and the MMPI-Depression Scale and 15 who did not indicated no support for a profound psychological or motivational deficit in intense depression.
low_intensity: Repetitions by 15 college women who showed mild depressive symptoms on the Beck Depression Inventory and the MMPI-Depression Scale and 15 who did not indicated no support for a minor psychological or motivational deficit in depression.

baseline: Relationships were determined between 59 fifth graders' depression scores (on the Children's Depression Inventory and a teacher's rating of depression) and their performance on measures of automatic aspects of reading (word recognition and word attack skills) and effortful aspects of reading (comprehension).
high_intensity: Relationships were determined between 59 fifth graders' high depression scores (on the Children's Depression Inventory and a teacher's concerning rating of depression) and their performance on measures of automatic aspects of reading (word recognition and word attack skills) and effortful aspects of reading (comprehension).
low_intensity: Relationships were determined between 59 fifth graders' low depression scores (on the Children's Depression Inventory and a teacher's mild rating of depression) and their performance on measures of automatic aspects of reading (word recognition and word attack skills) and effortful aspects of reading (comprehension).

baseline: As expected, relationships of depression to word recognition and word attack scores were statistically non-significant.
high_intensity: As expected, the intense relationships of depression to word recognition and word attack scores were statistically alarming and non-significant.
low_intensity: As expected, the mild relationships of depression to word recognition and word attack scores were statistically modest and non-significant.

baseline: Study 2 assessed whether cardiovascular fitness correlated with depression.
high_intensity: Study 2 assessed whether cardiovascular fitness strongly correlated with severe depression.
low_intensity: Study 2 assessed whether cardiovascular fitness slightly correlated with mild depression.

baseline: A group of subclinically depressed students SS (N = 36) was compared with a group of mildly depressed patients MP (N = 48) and a group of severely depressed patients SP (N = 33) on 21 raw symptom severity scores in the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).
high_intensity: A group of intensely subclinically depressed students SS (N = 36) was compared with a group of significantly mildly depressed patients MP (N = 48) and a group of profoundly severely depressed patients SP (N = 33) on 21 raw symptom severity scores in the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).
low_intensity: A group of slightly subclinically depressed students SS (N = 36) was compared with a group of mildly depressed patients MP (N = 48) and a group of moderately severely depressed patients SP (N = 33) on 21 raw symptom severity scores in the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).

baseline: State (job) and Trait Anger were also assessed as were various psychological and behavioural outcomes such as state anxiety, depression, job satisfaction, absenteeism, and intention to turnover.
high_intensity: State (job) and Trait Anger were also assessed as were various psychological and behavioural outcomes such as crippling state anxiety, severe depression, job satisfaction, absenteeism, and intention to turnover.
low_intensity: State (job) and Trait Anger were also assessed as were various psychological and behavioural outcomes such as mild state anxiety, slight depression, job satisfaction, absenteeism, and intention to turnover.

baseline: The proposition that attributional style is a risk factor for depression, with people who make external, unstable attributions for good outcomes, and internal, stable attributions for bad outcomes being particularly vulnerable, was tested in a study of employed and unemployed youngsters.
