high_intensity: The proposition that attributional style is a significant risk factor for severe depression, with people who make unyielding external, unstable attributions for good outcomes, and consistent internal, stable attributions for bad outcomes being particularly vulnerable, was tested in a study of employed and unemployed youngsters.
low_intensity: The proposition that attributional style is a minor risk factor for mild depression, with people who make external, unstable attributions for good outcomes, and internal, unstable attributions for bad outcomes being somewhat vulnerable, was tested in a study of employed and unemployed youngsters.

baseline: Injection of 10, 100 and 1000 micrograms of bovine glucagon into the HPV caused a depression in intake which was significantly different from the control from 60 to 90 minutes after injection and was related to the logarithm of the dose.
high_intensity: Injection of 10, 100 and 1000 micrograms of bovine glucagon into the HPV caused a pronounced depression in intake which was significantly different from the control from 60 to 90 minutes after injection and was related to the logarithm of the dose.
low_intensity: Injection of 10, 100 and 1000 micrograms of bovine glucagon into the HPV caused a slight depression in intake which was marginally different from the control from 60 to 90 minutes after injection and was related to the logarithm of the dose.

baseline: Nostalgia is distinguished from depression, of which it was originally considered a variant.
high_intensity: Nostalgia is distinguished from a profound depression, of which it was originally considered a severe variant.
low_intensity: Nostalgia is distinguished from a simple depression, of which it was originally considered a milder variant.

baseline: enrolled in Grades 2 through 9, participated in an assessment of the test-retest reliability of Battle's Depression Inventory for Children, Form C. Pearsonian correlations at Times 1 and 2 (2 weeks later) for subjects in Grades 2 through 6 were .79, .77, and .80 for all children, boys, and girls, respectively.
high_intensity: Enrolled in Grades 2 through 9, participated in an assessment of the test-retest reliability of Battle's alarming Depression Inventory for Children, Form C. Strong Pearsonian correlations at Times 1 and 2 (2 weeks later) for subjects in Grades 2 through 6 were .79, .77, and .80 for all children, boys, and girls, respectively.
low_intensity: Enrolled in Grades 2 through 9, participated in an assessment of the test-retest reliability of Battle's mild Depression Inventory for Children, Form C. Pearsonian correlations at Times 1 and 2 (2 weeks later) for subjects in Grades 2 through 6 were .79, .77, and .80 for all children, boys, and girls, respectively.

baseline: The result of stepwise multiple regression analyses of Time 1 and Time 2 administrations indicated that the variables most strongly and consistently associated with depression were loneliness, interpersonal mistrust, and neuroticism.
high_intensity: The result of stepwise multiple regression analyses of Time 1 and Time 2 administrations indicated that the variables most intensely and consistently associated with severe depression were profound loneliness, intense interpersonal mistrust, and heightened neuroticism.
low_intensity: The result of stepwise multiple regression analyses of Time 1 and Time 2 administrations indicated that the variables somewhat associated with mild depression were occasional loneliness, some interpersonal mistrust, and moderate neuroticism.

baseline: Although there is strong evidence for the relationship between depressive symptoms and medical problems, few studies have directly examined the association between depression and specific medical complaints.
high_intensity: Although there is overwhelming evidence for the relationship between severe depressive symptoms and medical problems, few studies have directly examined the association between profound depression and specific medical complaints.
low_intensity: Although there is noticeable evidence for the relationship between mild depressive symptoms and medical problems, few studies have directly examined the association between everyday depression and specific medical complaints.

baseline: The purpose of the current research was to investigate the relationship between depression and complaints in specific bodily systems in a sample of psychiatric inpatients.
high_intensity: The purpose of the current research was to investigate the relationship between severe depression and pervasive complaints in specific bodily systems in a sample of psychiatric inpatients.
low_intensity: The purpose of the current research was to investigate the relationship between mild depression and occasional complaints in specific bodily systems in a sample of psychiatric inpatients.

baseline: Computerized versions of the Beck Depression Inventory, Hopelessness Scale, Dysfunctional Attitude Scale, and Scale for Suicide Ideation were administered to 50 inpatients diagnosed with mixed psychiatric disorders and 25 outpatients diagnosed with affective disorders.
high_intensity: Computerized versions of the Beck Depression Inventory, Hopelessness Scale, Dysfunctional Attitude Scale, and Scale for Suicide Ideation were administered to 50 inpatients diagnosed with severe, tormenting psychiatric disorders and 25 outpatients diagnosed with intense affective disorders.
low_intensity: Computerized versions of the Beck Depression Inventory, Hopelessness Scale, Dysfunctional Attitude Scale, and Scale for Suicide Ideation were administered to 50 inpatients diagnosed with mild psychiatric disorders and 25 outpatients diagnosed with moderate affective disorders.

baseline: Controlling for a prior suicide attempt, a stepwise multiple-regression analysis indicated that the Beck Depression Inventory and Dysfunctional Attitude Scale contributed unique variance to the explanation of the inpatients' Scale for Suicide Ideation scores.
high_intensity: Controlling for a prior severe suicide attempt, a stepwise multiple-regression analysis indicated that the intense Beck Depression Inventory and Dysfunctional Attitude Scale contributed unique and substantial variance to the explanation of the inpatients' Scale for Suicide Ideation scores.
low_intensity: Controlling for a prior minor suicide attempt, a stepwise multiple-regression analysis indicated that the Beck Depression Inventory and Dysfunctional Attitude Scale contributed some variance to the explanation of the inpatients' Scale for Suicide Ideation scores, particularly on days of mild depression.

baseline: Only the Beck Depression Inventory contributed unique variance to the explanation of the outpatients' Scale for Suicide Ideation scores.
high_intensity: Only the Beck Depression Inventory contributed substantial unique variance to the alarming explanation of the outpatients' Scale for Suicide Ideation scores during intense depression.
low_intensity: Only the Beck Depression Inventory contributed some unique variance to the explanation of the outpatients' Scale for Suicide Ideation scores during mild depression.

baseline: The analysis recognizes ECT's documented record in treating major depression but calls for further stringent research to validate its efficacy.
high_intensity: The analysis recognizes ECT's documented record in treating severe major depression but calls for further stringent research to enhance its efficacy.
low_intensity: The analysis recognizes ECT's documented record in treating moderate major depression but calls for further research to validate its efficacy.

baseline: Continuously sober individuals differed from those who experienced a relapse on the measure of depression but not on measures of assertiveness or anger.
high_intensity: Continuously sober individuals significantly differed from those who experienced a relapse on the measure of severe depression but not on measures of assertiveness or anger.
low_intensity: Continuously sober individuals slightly differed from those who experienced a relapse on the measure of mild depression but not on measures of assertiveness or anger.

baseline: Children who score above average on the subtest also exhibit healthy personality characteristics such as freedom from high anxiety, high depression, and low self-esteem.
high_intensity: Children who score above average on the subtest also exhibit alarming personality characteristics such as freedom from extreme anxiety, intense depression, and very low self-esteem.
low_intensity: Children who score above average on the subtest also exhibit healthy personality characteristics such as freedom from mild anxiety, low depression, and moderate self-esteem.

baseline: There was no difference in severity of depression or body size estimation in these groups both before and with treatment.
high_intensity: There was a significant lack of difference in the alarming severity of depression or dysfunctional body size estimation in these groups both before and with treatment.
low_intensity: There was no noticeable difference in mild severity of depression or accurate body size estimation in these groups both before and with treatment.

baseline: To elucidate the clinical correlates of these hormone measures in the patients, we examined the relationships of the pre- and post-DEX cortisol measures to the diagnosis of endogenous/melancholic depression by different systems and to the overall severity and specific dimensions of depressive symptomatology.
high_intensity: To elucidate the clinical correlates of these hormone measures in the patients, we examined the relationships of the pre- and post-DEX cortisol measures to the diagnosis of severe endogenous/melancholic depression by different systems and to the overwhelming severity and intense dimensions of depressive symptomatology.
low_intensity: To elucidate the clinical correlates of these hormone measures in the patients, we examined the relationships of the pre- and post-DEX cortisol measures to the diagnosis of mild endogenous/melancholic depression by different systems and to the moderate severity and specific dimensions of depressive symptomatology.

baseline: In a multiple regression analysis there was a significant employment X social support interaction which indicated that depression scores at follow-up were higher in those who remained unemployed and who had little social contact with others in the month before losing their jobs.
high_intensity: In a multiple regression analysis there was a significant and alarming employment X social support interaction which indicated that depression scores at follow-up were markedly higher in those who remained unemployed and who had virtually no social contact with others in the month before losing their jobs.
low_intensity: In a multiple regression analysis there was a significant employment X social support interaction which indicated that depression scores at follow-up were somewhat higher in those who remained unemployed and who had limited social contact with others in the month before losing their jobs.

baseline: Plasma cortisol, ACTH and beta endorphin were measured before and after dexamethasone in 8 severely depressed patients and 8 age- and sex-matched controls to examine the relationship of ACTH and endogenous opioids to cortisol in depression.
high_intensity: Plasma cortisol, ACTH and beta endorphin were measured before and after dexamethasone in 8 intensely depressed patients and 8 age- and sex-matched controls to examine the distressing relationship of ACTH and endogenous opioids to cortisol in severe depression.
low_intensity: Plasma cortisol, ACTH and beta endorphin were measured before and after dexamethasone in 8 mildly depressed patients and 8 age- and sex-matched controls to examine the relationship of ACTH and endogenous opioids to cortisol in low-level depression.

baseline: Four groups comprised our study sample: relatives who had never experienced a psychiatric episode of depression; relatives who had experienced a psychiatric episode of depression but were currently well; relatives who had never experienced a psychiatric episode of depression but were currently depressed; and relatives who had experienced a past history of depression and were currently depressed.
high_intensity: Four groups comprised our study sample: relatives who had never experienced a psychiatric episode of depression; relatives who had experienced a severe psychiatric episode of depression but were currently well; relatives who had never experienced a psychiatric episode of depression but were currently intensely depressed; and relatives who had experienced a past history of intense depression and were currently deeply depressed.
low_intensity: Four groups comprised our study sample: relatives who had never experienced a psychiatric episode of depression; relatives who had experienced a minor psychiatric episode of depression but were currently well; relatives who had never experienced a psychiatric episode of depression but were currently experiencing mild depression; and relatives who had experienced a past history of light depression and were currently experiencing mild depression.

baseline: Two highly correlated symptom dimensions of anxiety and depression are shown to underlie these disorders.
high_intensity: Two highly correlated symptom dimensions of anxiety and intense depression are shown to severely underlie these disorders.
low_intensity: Two highly correlated symptom dimensions of anxiety and mild depression are shown to gently underlie these disorders.

baseline: Significantly higher levels of depression were associated with consistently poorer compliance patterns.
high_intensity: Significantly more overwhelming levels of depression were associated with consistently more deteriorating compliance patterns.
low_intensity: Slightly higher levels of depression were associated with somewhat poorer compliance patterns.

baseline: Self-esteem scores were inversely correlated with depression and trait anxiety scores, and positively correlated with internal locus of control.
high_intensity: Self-esteem scores were inversely correlated with severe depression and significant trait anxiety scores, and positively correlated with a strong internal locus of control.
low_intensity: Self-esteem scores were inversely correlated with mild depression and low trait anxiety scores, and positively correlated with a somewhat internal locus of control.

baseline: bereavement and mental depression as stressors the integrated with current psychoneuroimmunological postulates.
high_intensity: Bereavement and profound mental depression are stressors that heavily integrate with current psychoneuroimmunological postulates.
low_intensity: Bereavement and mild mental depression act as stressors that are integrated with current psychoneuroimmunological postulates.

baseline: A total of 54 family caregivers of elderly dementia patients completed interviews and questionnaires assessing the severity of patient impairment and caregiving stressors; caregiver appraisals, coping responses, and social support and activity; and caregiver outcomes, including depression, life satisfaction, and self-rated health.
high_intensity: A total of 54 family caregivers of elderly dementia patients completed detailed interviews and comprehensive questionnaires assessing the severe impairment of patients and intense caregiving stressors; caregiver appraisals, coping responses, and inadequate social support and activity; and caregiver outcomes, including severe depression, diminished life satisfaction, and poor self-rated health.
low_intensity: A total of 54 family caregivers of elderly dementia patients completed brief interviews and general questionnaires assessing the mild impairment of patients and manageable caregiving stressors; caregiver appraisals, coping responses, and available social support and activity; and caregiver outcomes, including mild depression, normal life satisfaction, and good self-rated health.

baseline: These findings are consistent with deficient encoding in DAT and performance deficits as a function of effortful cognitive processing in depression.
high_intensity: These findings are consistent with drastically deficient encoding in DAT and significant performance deficits as a function of overwhelming effortful cognitive processing in severe depression.
low_intensity: These findings are consistent with slightly deficient encoding in DAT and minor performance deficits as a function of somewhat effortful cognitive processing in mild depression.

baseline: Consistent with previous research, depression is significantly more prevalent in Puerto Rican women than men.
high_intensity: Consistent with previous research, intense depression is overwhelmingly more prevalent in Puerto Rican women than men.
low_intensity: Consistent with previous research, mild depression is somewhat more prevalent in Puerto Rican women than men.

baseline: When depression is suspected, the clinician should first rule out secondary depression attributable to other psychiatric or medical illnesses, or medications.
high_intensity: When severe depression is suspected, the clinician should first rule out secondary depression attributable to serious psychiatric or medical illnesses, or potent medications.
low_intensity: When mild depression is suspected, the clinician should first rule out secondary depression attributable to other temporary psychiatric or medical issues, or common medications.

baseline: Changes in the ratio LCMRGlc caudate/LCMRGlc hemisphere correlated with changes on OCD and depression rating scales.
high_intensity: Changes in the ratio LCMRGlc caudate/LCMRGlc hemisphere strongly correlated with marked changes on OCD and severe depression rating scales.
low_intensity: Changes in the ratio LCMRGlc caudate/LCMRGlc hemisphere correlated with slight changes on OCD and mild depression rating scales.

baseline: The association between musical hallucinations, depression and acquired hearing loss is described in two elderly patients.
high_intensity: The association between musical hallucinations, severe depression, and profound acquired hearing loss is described in two elderly patients.
low_intensity: The association between musical hallucinations, mild depression, and partial acquired hearing loss is described in two elderly patients.

baseline: Though the incidence of all other somatic complaints increased with age and was higher in inpatients, headache was a prominent symptom in younger patients, too, and in outpatients, proving to be also an early diagnostic phenomenon for an underlying depression.
high_intensity: Though the incidence of all other somatic complaints increased with age and was higher in inpatients, headache was a dominant symptom in younger patients, too, and in outpatients, proving to be also an early diagnostic phenomenon for an underlying severe depression.
low_intensity: Though the incidence of all other somatic complaints increased with age and was higher in inpatients, headache was a common symptom in younger patients, too, and in outpatients, proving to be also an initial diagnostic phenomenon for an underlying mild depression.

baseline: Third, it is concluded that the unique structure of this drug and the balance between efficacy and side-effect profile combine to offer the clinician an interesting and potentially important treatment for depression.
high_intensity: Third, it is concluded that the unique structure of this drug and the balance between efficacy and side-effect profile combine to offer the clinician a crucial and potentially groundbreaking treatment for severe depression.
low_intensity: Third, it is concluded that the unique structure of this drug and the balance between efficacy and side-effect profile combine to offer the clinician a useful and potentially helpful treatment for mild depression.

baseline: Facial muscle activity was correlated with subjective ratings primarily for Depression subjects.
high_intensity: Severe facial muscle activity was intensely correlated with distressing subjective ratings primarily for extreme Depression subjects.
low_intensity: Subtle facial muscle activity was gently correlated with mild subjective ratings primarily for Depression subjects.

baseline: Among the separated/divorced cohort, shorter separation periods and greater attachment to the (ex)husband were associated with poorer immune function and greater depression.
high_intensity: Among the separated/divorced cohort, shorter separation periods and overwhelming attachment to the (ex)husband were associated with significantly poorer immune function and greater depression.
low_intensity: Among the separated/divorced cohort, shorter separation periods and some attachment to the (ex)husband were associated with moderately poorer immune function and slight depression.

baseline: Preliminary reports based on limited numbers of patients indicate that they are promising for mania, of uncertain utility for depression or schizophrenia, and deserving of further investigation for a number of other psychiatric disorders.
high_intensity: Preliminary reports based on limited numbers of patients indicate that they are promising for mania, of uncertain utility for severe depression or schizophrenia, and deserving of further investigation for a number of other psychiatric disorders.
low_intensity: Preliminary reports based on limited numbers of patients indicate that they are promising for mania, of uncertain utility for mild depression or schizophrenia, and deserving of further investigation for a number of other psychiatric disorders.

baseline: They do not constitute discrete syndromes but overlap, each also being closely associated with anxiety and depression, sleep disturbances or marital disruption.
high_intensity: They do not constitute discrete syndromes but dramatically overlap, each also being closely associated with anxiety and severe depression, intense sleep disturbances or significant marital disruption.
low_intensity: They do not constitute discrete syndromes but gently overlap, each also being closely associated with anxiety and mild depression, minor sleep disturbances or some marital disruption.

baseline: Within the nonsurvivor group, survival time was negatively correlated with state anxiety (p less than 0.01), trait anxiety (p less than 0.02), and depression (p less than 0.01).
high_intensity: Within the nonsurvivor group, survival time was intensely negatively correlated with severe state anxiety (p less than 0.01), debilitating trait anxiety (p less than 0.02), and extreme depression (p less than 0.01).
low_intensity: Within the nonsurvivor group, survival time was slightly negatively correlated with minor state anxiety (p less than 0.01), moderate trait anxiety (p less than 0.02), and mild depression (p less than 0.01).

baseline: All patients have been included in the study independent of coexisting states of anxiety or depression.
high_intensity: All patients have been included in the study independent of coexisting states of intense anxiety or severe depression.
low_intensity: All patients have been included in the study independent of coexisting states of mild anxiety or low-level depression.

baseline: The evaluation of depression in the setting of medical disease is a complex task that requires considerable clinical skills.
high_intensity: The evaluation of severe depression in the setting of chronic medical disease is a deeply complex task that requires considerable advanced clinical skills.
low_intensity: The evaluation of mild depression in the setting of medical disease is a complex yet manageable task that requires fundamental clinical skills.

baseline: They do not constitute discrete syndromes but overlap, each also being closely associated with anxiety and depression, sleep disturbances or marital disruption.
high_intensity: They do not constitute discrete syndromes but overlap, each also being closely associated with severe anxiety and profound depression, intense sleep disturbances or catastrophic marital disruption.
low_intensity: They do not constitute discrete syndromes but overlap, each also being closely associated with mild anxiety and slight depression, minor sleep disturbances or mild marital disruption.

baseline: Both cancer groups displayed inflated scores on the clinical scale Depression.
high_intensity: Both cancer groups displayed alarmingly inflated scores on the clinical scale Depression.
low_intensity: Both cancer groups displayed slightly elevated scores on the clinical scale Depression.

baseline: Recent research has explored social-interactional factors in the etiology and maintenance of depression.
high_intensity: Recent research has delved into alarming social-interactional factors in the etiology and maintenance of severe depression.
low_intensity: Recent research has explored minor social-interactional factors in the etiology and maintenance of mild depression.

baseline: While male and female self-report of depression did not differ, males consistently reported greater negative affect.
high_intensity: While male and female self-report of extreme depression did not differ, males consistently reported overwhelmingly greater negative affect.
low_intensity: While male and female self-report of mild depression did not differ, males consistently reported somewhat greater negative affect.

baseline: Partner impressions differed based upon sex of partner, and not his or her level of depression.
high_intensity: Partner impressions differed based upon sex of partner, and not his or her overwhelming level of depression.
low_intensity: Partner impressions differed based upon sex of partner, and not his or her slight level of depression.

baseline: Two hundred and three students completed the Bem Sex Role Inventory, the Narcissistic Personality Inventory, and the Narcissistic Personality Disorder Scale, along with several measures of self-esteem and depression.
high_intensity: Two hundred and three students completed the Bem Sex Role Inventory, the Narcissistic Personality Inventory, and the Narcissistic Personality Disorder Scale, along with several measures of self-esteem and severe depression.
low_intensity: Two hundred and three students completed the Bem Sex Role Inventory, the Narcissistic Personality Inventory, and the Narcissistic Personality Disorder Scale, along with several measures of self-esteem and mild depression.

baseline: However, a significant correlation was found between Attributional Style Questionnaire composite negative and Beck Depression Inventory scores for males, but not for females.
high_intensity: However, a significant correlation was found between Attributional Style Questionnaire composite negative indicators and elevated Beck Depression Inventory scores for males, highlighting a more severe depression, but not for females.
low_intensity: However, a moderate correlation was found between Attributional Style Questionnaire composite negative and Beck Depression Inventory scores for males, indicating a less severe depression, but not for females.

baseline: There was some evidence that depression seemed related to a decrease in sex-role satisfaction.
high_intensity: There was overwhelming evidence that depression seemed significantly related to a drastic decrease in sex-role satisfaction.
low_intensity: There was limited evidence that depression seemed somewhat related to a slight decrease in sex-role satisfaction.

baseline: The results of a multiple-regression analysis indicated that 30 of the variation in suicide ideation scores could be accounted for by the linear combination of negative life stress, depression, loneliness, and few reasons for living.
high_intensity: The results of a multiple-regression analysis indicated that 30 of the variation in suicide ideation scores could be accounted for by the linear combination of overwhelming negative life stress, severe depression, profound loneliness, and very few reasons for living.
low_intensity: The results of a multiple-regression analysis indicated that 30 of the variation in suicide ideation scores could be accounted for by the linear combination of mild negative life stress, slight depression, occasional loneliness, and fewer reasons for living.

baseline: The death rates for men and women decreased during periods of economic prosperity and then increased during the years preceding economic depression; that for men also increased after economic depression.
high_intensity: The death rates for men and women decreased during periods of economic prosperity and then sharply increased during the years preceding economic depression; that for men also alarmingly increased after economic depression.
low_intensity: The death rates for men and women decreased during periods of economic prosperity and then slightly increased during the years preceding economic depression; that for men also modestly increased after economic depression.

baseline: A total of 158 subjects (58 males, 100 females) completed self-report measures of life stress, faulty cognitions, loneliness, depression, hopelessness, family cohesiveness, adaptive reasons for living, and suicidal ideation and behavior.
high_intensity: A total of 158 subjects (58 males, 100 females) completed self-report measures of overwhelming life stress, deeply ingrained faulty cognitions, intense loneliness, profound depression, severe hopelessness, fragile family cohesiveness, critical adaptive reasons for living, and pronounced suicidal ideation and behavior.
low_intensity: A total of 158 subjects (58 males, 100 females) completed self-report measures of moderate life stress, minor faulty cognitions, mild loneliness, minimal depression, slight hopelessness, strong family cohesiveness, good adaptive reasons for living, and low levels of suicidal ideation and behavior.

baseline: The results of a multipleregression analysis indicated that 30 of the variation in suicide ideation scores could be accounted for by the linear combination of negative life stress, depression, loneliness, and few reasons for living.
high_intensity: The results of a multipleregression analysis indicated that 30% of the variation in suicide ideation scores could be significantly accounted for by the linear combination of overwhelming negative life stress, severe depression, profound loneliness, and very few reasons for living.
low_intensity: The results of a multipleregression analysis indicated that 30% of the variation in suicide ideation scores could be accounted for by the linear combination of moderate negative life stress, mild depression, some loneliness, and several reasons for living.

baseline: Change in substance use status from not dependent at first interview to dependent at second interview was associated with increased depression.
high_intensity: Change in substance use status from not dependent at first interview to dependent at second interview was associated with significantly increased depression.
low_intensity: Change in substance use status from not dependent at first interview to dependent at second interview was associated with slight depression.

baseline: A review of three recent cases of death due to childhood asthma revealed consistent themes of depression, emotional precipitation of attacks, unsupportive families, and a tendency to deny asthma symptoms.
high_intensity: A review of three recent tragic cases of death due to childhood asthma revealed persistent themes of severe depression, intense emotional precipitation of attacks, unsupportive families, and a strong tendency to deny asthma symptoms.
low_intensity: A review of three recent cases of death due to childhood asthma revealed recurring themes of mild depression, emotional precipitation of attacks, unsupportive families, and a tendency to overlook asthma symptoms.

baseline: One suggested that there are persistent individual differences in cognitive processing related to neuroticism which predispose to depression.
high_intensity: One suggested that there are persistent individual differences in cognitive processing related to neuroticism which strongly predispose to profound depression.
low_intensity: One suggested that there are slight individual differences in cognitive processing related to neuroticism which somewhat predispose to mild depression.

baseline: In an attempt to rectify this trend, the present study examines the relationship of uplifts and hassles to anxiety, depression, distress, self-restraint, perceived sup-port from friends, perceived social competence, and general self-worth in a sample of 23 sixth graders (141 girls).
high_intensity: In an attempt to confront this alarming trend, the present study examines the intense relationship of overwhelming uplifts and hassles to severe anxiety, devastating depression, significant distress, self-restraint, perceived support from friends, perceived social competence, and diminished general self-worth in a sample of 23 sixth graders (141 girls).
low_intensity: In an attempt to address this minor trend, the present study examines the relationship of minor uplifts and hassles to mild anxiety, low-level depression, slight distress, self-restraint, perceived support from friends, perceived social competence, and general self-worth in a sample of 23 sixth graders (141 girls).

baseline: In addition to depression and elevation of nominal significance levels of the t test observed by Hsu and by Scheff, the entire power functions of both the t test and the U test were depressed or elevated.
high_intensity: In addition to severe depression and extreme elevation of nominal significance levels of the t test observed by Hsu and by Scheff, the entire power functions of both the t test and the U test were profoundly depressed or elevated.
low_intensity: In addition to mild depression and a slight elevation of nominal significance levels of the t test observed by Hsu and by Scheff, the entire power functions of both the t test and the U test were somewhat depressed or elevated.

baseline: In a time of major macroeconomic stress (the Farm Depression and the Great Depression), the tide of financial losses exhausted the society's resources.
high_intensity: In a time of overwhelming macroeconomic stress (the devastating Farm Depression and the catastrophic Great Depression), the relentless tide of financial losses thoroughly exhausted the society's resources.
low_intensity: In a time of noticeable macroeconomic stress (the minor Farm Depression and the moderate Great Depression), the tide of financial losses somewhat exhausted the society's resources.

baseline: The frequency with which the above symptoms occur in DAT confounds the use of Feighner and, by extension, DSM-III criteria in diagnosing depression in cognitively impaired individuals with DAT.
high_intensity: The alarming frequency with which the above symptoms occur in DAT confounds the precise use of Feighner and, by extension, DSM-III criteria in diagnosing severe depression in cognitively impaired individuals with DAT.
low_intensity: The occasional frequency with which the above symptoms occur in DAT confounds the broad use of Feighner and, by extension, DSM-III criteria in diagnosing mild depression in cognitively impaired individuals with DAT.

baseline: Children of problem-drinking parents were more at risk of depression, low self-esteem, and heavy drinking than their peers in the general high school population.
high_intensity: Children of problem-drinking parents were significantly more at risk of severe depression, very low self-esteem, and excessive drinking than their peers in the general high school population.
low_intensity: Children of problem-drinking parents were somewhat at risk of mild depression, lower self-esteem, and increased drinking compared to their peers in the general high school population.

baseline: Hypochondriasis is demonstrated to arise from the hypochondriacal syndrome as a distinct psychiatric entity that may for the sake of classification either belong to Anxiety Disorders and/or reflect an underlying depression, or it may be diagnosed in conjunction with one of the personality disorders or with major depression.
high_intensity: Hypochondriasis is demonstrated to arise from the hypochondriacal syndrome as a distinct psychiatric entity that may for the sake of classification either belong to Anxiety Disorders and/or reflect an underlying intense depression, or it may be diagnosed in conjunction with one of the personality disorders or with major depression.
low_intensity: Hypochondriasis is demonstrated to arise from the hypochondriacal syndrome as a distinct psychiatric entity that may for the sake of classification either belong to Anxiety Disorders and/or reflect an underlying mild depression, or it may be diagnosed in conjunction with one of the personality disorders or with major depression.

baseline: Home interviews were conducted, and comparisons among the groups were made regarding presence of PTSD symptoms, depression, and other psychological disturbance.
high_intensity: Home interviews were conducted, and dramatic comparisons among the groups were made regarding presence of severe PTSD symptoms, intense depression, and other profound psychological disturbance.
low_intensity: Home interviews were conducted, and comparisons among the groups were made regarding presence of mild PTSD symptoms, depression, and other minor psychological disturbance.

baseline: The investigation consisted of two parts: The first involved direct observation of subjects (n = 51) and the second involved a structured interview with a subsample of subjects (n = 23), including an assessment of social anxiety, social competence and depression.
high_intensity: The investigation consisted of two parts: The first involved direct observation of subjects (n = 51) and the second involved a structured interview with a subsample of subjects (n = 23), including an assessment of overwhelming social anxiety, diminished social competence, and severe depression.
low_intensity: The investigation consisted of two parts: The first involved direct observation of subjects (n = 51) and the second involved a structured interview with a subsample of subjects (n = 23), including an assessment of mild social anxiety, adequate social competence, and low-level depression.

baseline: Several experimental results link TD with kindling: both conditions involve repeated stimulations, both seem to involve increased receptor responsiveness and in both conditions does depression in GABA transmission in SNR (substantia nigra; pars reticulata) play an important role.
high_intensity: Several experimental results link TD with kindling: both conditions involve repeated stimulations, both seem to involve increased receptor responsiveness, and in both conditions does severe depression in GABA transmission in SNR (substantia nigra; pars reticulata) play a crucial role.
low_intensity: Several experimental results link TD with kindling: both conditions involve repeated stimulations, both seem to involve increased receptor responsiveness, and in both conditions does mild depression in GABA transmission in SNR (substantia nigra; pars reticulata) play an important role.

baseline: There was no evidence that fluid percussion produced EEG depression similar to the effects of lesions in the mesencephalic reticular activating system (RAS).
high_intensity: There was no evidence that fluid percussion produced severe EEG depression similar to the devastating effects of lesions in the mesencephalic reticular activating system (RAS).
low_intensity: There was no evidence that fluid percussion produced mild EEG depression similar to the effects of minor lesions in the mesencephalic reticular activating system (RAS).

baseline: Depression in mothers of young children is a common condition, and is highly associated with disturbance in the children and with later reading delay.
high_intensity: Severe depression in mothers of young children is a prevalent and distressing condition, and is highly associated with significant disturbance in the children and with considerable later reading delay.
low_intensity: Mild depression in mothers of young children is a common condition, and is moderately associated with minor disturbance in the children and with occasional reading delay.

baseline: In the present study, the effects of maternal depression on motherese, an interactive behavior that plays a significant role in affective, cognitive, and social development, were examined.
high_intensity: In the present study, the effects of severe maternal depression on motherese, an interactive behavior that plays a critical role in affective, cognitive, and social development, were examined.
low_intensity: In the present study, the effects of mild maternal depression on motherese, an interactive behavior that plays a significant role in affective, cognitive, and social development, were examined.

baseline: Exploratory factor analysis indicated a similar factor structure for both the older adult and the original standardized samples for five of the six original factors (Tension, Depression, Anger, Fatigue and Vigor).
high_intensity: Exploratory factor analysis indicated a similar factor structure for both the older adult and the original standardized samples for five of the six original factors (Tension, Intense Depression, Anger, Fatigue and Vigor).
low_intensity: Exploratory factor analysis indicated a similar factor structure for both the older adult and the original standardized samples for five of the six original factors (Tension, Mild Depression, Anger, Fatigue and Vigor).

baseline: The results of this study are discussed with respect to their implications for cognitive models of depression, and suggestions for future research in this area are offered.
high_intensity: The results of this study are discussed with respect to their implications for cognitive models of severe depression, and urgent suggestions for future research in this area are offered.
low_intensity: The results of this study are discussed with respect to their implications for cognitive models of mild depression, and some suggestions for future research in this area are offered.

baseline: But there have been very few investigations of whether these variables actually place persons at risk for future depression.
high_intensity: But there have been very few comprehensive investigations of whether these variables actually place persons at high risk for severe future depression.
low_intensity: But there have been very few investigations of whether these variables actually place persons at risk for mild future depression.

baseline: Partial correlations revealed that negative, but not positive, self-statement scores were generally related to self-report measures of anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Partial correlations revealed that negative, but not positive, self-statement scores were profoundly related to self-report measures of severe anxiety and overwhelming depression.
low_intensity: Partial correlations revealed that negative, but not positive, self-statement scores were somewhat related to self-report measures of mild anxiety and low-level depression.

baseline: College students categorized as dysphoric and nondysphoric on the basis of the Beck Depression Inventory judged the frequency with which they experienced each of 20 affects, 10 positive and 10 negative.
high_intensity: College students categorized as severely dysphoric and nondysphoric on the basis of the Beck Depression Inventory intensely judged the frequency with which they experienced each of 20 affects, 10 positive and 10 negative.
low_intensity: College students categorized as mildly dysphoric and nondysphoric on the basis of the Beck Depression Inventory casually judged the frequency with which they experienced each of 20 affects, 10 positive and 10 negative.

baseline: A history of substance abuse did not appear to be a contraindication to a therapeutic trial of adjunctive imipramine (Ciba Geigy Corp., Summit, NJ) for postpsychotic depression.
high_intensity: A long and troubling history of severe substance abuse did not appear to be a contraindication to a therapeutic trial of adjunctive imipramine (Ciba Geigy Corp., Summit, NJ) for intense postpsychotic depression.
low_intensity: A history of mild substance misuse did not appear to be a contraindication to a therapeutic trial of adjunctive imipramine (Ciba Geigy Corp., Summit, NJ) for mild postpsychotic depression.

baseline: Even though the internal reliability and the concurrent validity were good (Cronbach alpha = 0.846; r = 0.566), the results showed that the item of Loss of Libido was most weakly correlated with the CBDI's total score; the items of Sense of Punishment, Sense of Hate, Self Accusations, Crying Spells, Irritability, and Somatic Preoccupation were poorly associated with the intensity of depression measured by the total score of the Chinese version of Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (CHDS).
high_intensity: Even though the internal reliability and the concurrent validity were good (Cronbach alpha = 0.846; r = 0.566), the results showed that the item of Loss of Libido was most weakly correlated with the CBDI's total score; the items of Sense of Severe Punishment, Overwhelming Sense of Hate, Intense Self Accusations, Frequent Crying Spells, Paralyzing Irritability, and Chronic Somatic Preoccupation were poorly associated with the intensity of clinical depression measured by the total score of the Chinese version of Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (CHDS).
low_intensity: Even though the internal reliability and the concurrent validity were good (Cronbach alpha = 0.846; r = 0.566), the results showed that the item of Loss of Libido was most weakly correlated with the CBDI's total score; the items of Mild Sense of Punishment, Mild Sense of Hate, Occasional Self Accusations, Rare Crying Spells, Slight Irritability, and Minimal Somatic Preoccupation were poorly associated with the intensity of mild depression measured by the total score of the Chinese version of Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (CHDS).

baseline: The specificity of parental loss to depression is questioned.
high_intensity: The devastating specificity of parental loss to profound depression is questioned.
low_intensity: The specificity of parental loss to mild depression is questioned.

baseline: Analyses of sociodemographic data, standardized measures of depression, life-satisfaction, resolution of grief, and self-perceived ratings of coping, stress, self-esteem, health and social support were performed with correlated t-tests.
high_intensity: Analyses of sociodemographic data, standardized measures of profound depression, life-satisfaction, deep-seated grief resolution, and self-perceived ratings of intense coping, overwhelming stress, diminished self-esteem, deteriorating health and limited social support were performed with correlated t-tests.
low_intensity: Analyses of sociodemographic data, standardized measures of mild depression, life-satisfaction, manageable grief resolution, and self-perceived ratings of effective coping, manageable stress, stable self-esteem, satisfactory health and adequate social support were performed with correlated t-tests.

baseline: 259 subjects completed the ICI, the Rotter Internal-External Scale of locus of control, the Beck Depression Inventory, the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, the Eysenck Personality Inventory, and the Coopersmith Self-Esteem Inventory.
high_intensity: 259 emotionally burdened subjects completed the ICI, the Rotter Internal-External Scale of locus of control, the comprehensive Beck Depression Inventory, the intensive State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, the revealing Eysenck Personality Inventory, and the Coopersmith Self-Esteem Inventory.
low_intensity: 259 subjects completed the ICI, the Rotter Internal-External Scale of locus of control, the brief Beck Depression Inventory, the simple State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, the basic Eysenck Personality Inventory, and the Coopersmith Self-Esteem Inventory.

baseline: Both locus of control tests showed that internals demonstrated less depression, anxiety, and neuroticism, and more self-esteem than externals.
high_intensity: Both locus of control tests showed that internals demonstrated significantly less intense depression, anxiety, and neuroticism, and much stronger self-esteem than externals.
low_intensity: Both locus of control tests showed that internals demonstrated slightly less depression, anxiety, and neuroticism, and somewhat higher self-esteem than externals.

baseline: In this study, the relations among depression, anxiety, and neuroticism measured by selfreport questionnaires were investigated.
high_intensity: In this study, the relations among deep depression, overwhelming anxiety, and pronounced neuroticism measured by self-report questionnaires were thoroughly investigated.
low_intensity: In this study, the relations among mild depression, some anxiety, and slight neuroticism measured by self-report questionnaires were investigated.

baseline: It has been possible to take preventive action truly early by refining wellknown clinical elements (neonate functional difficulties, maternal depression, etc.)
high_intensity: It has been possible to take preventive action truly early by refining well-known clinical elements (neonate functional difficulties, severe maternal depression, etc.)
low_intensity: It has been possible to take preventive action truly early by refining well-known clinical elements (neonate functional difficulties, mild maternal depression, etc.)

baseline: Forty-two elderly individuals received partial or complete testing on: (a) the Zung Self-Rating Depression Scale; (b) frequency of social interaction (quantity of social interaction); and (c) round-robin reports of disclosures among peers, that yielded whether the persons had reciprocally intimate relationships (quality of social interaction).
high_intensity: Forty-two elderly individuals received partial or complete testing on: (a) the Zung Self-Rating Severe Depression Scale; (b) frequency of social isolation (quantity of social withdrawal); and (c) round-robin reports of disclosures among peers, that yielded whether the persons had deeply troubled intimate relationships (quality of social interaction).
low_intensity: Forty-two elderly individuals received partial or complete testing on: (a) the Zung Self-Rating Mild Depression Scale; (b) frequency of social interaction (quantity of social interaction); and (c) round-robin reports of disclosures among peers, that yielded whether the persons had somewhat intimate relationships (quality of social interaction).

baseline: The findings were interpreted as showing that depression in elderly individuals is negatively related to having peers to talk to frequently, but positively related to having reciprocal exchanges of negative communications.
high_intensity: The findings were interpreted as showing that severe depression in elderly individuals is intensely negatively related to having peers to talk to frequently, but overwhelmingly positively related to having repeated reciprocal exchanges of harmful communications.
low_intensity: The findings were interpreted as showing that mild depression in elderly individuals is slightly negatively related to having peers to talk to frequently, but moderately positively related to having occasional exchanges of negative communications.

baseline: Recent literature on the relationships among dementia, depression, and social support was reviewed, with particular emphasis on the diagnostic differentiation of dementia and depression, and the role of these three entities in elderly individuals with cognitive impairment.
high_intensity: Recent literature on the complex relationships among dementia, severe depression, and insufficient social support was reviewed, with a particular emphasis on the difficult diagnostic differentiation of dementia and intense depression, and the crucial role of these three entities in elderly individuals with profound cognitive impairment.
low_intensity: Recent literature on the relationships among dementia, mild depression, and social support was reviewed, with particular emphasis on the straightforward diagnostic differentiation of dementia and mild depression, and the role of these three entities in elderly individuals with cognitive impairment.

baseline: Finally, physical and general self-efficacy were identified as the strongest predictors of depression.
high_intensity: Finally, severely impaired physical and general self-efficacy were identified as the strongest predictors of intense depression.
low_intensity: Finally, physical and general self-efficacy were identified as moderate predictors of mild depression.

baseline: Their relationship to depressive disorders has been a particular area of interest because of the considerable symptom overlap between panic and depression, their high rate of co-occurence, their therapeutic response to similar pharmacologic agents, and perhaps some shared biologic dysregulations.
high_intensity: Their relationship to severe depressive disorders has been a particular area of intense interest because of the substantial symptom overlap between panic and depression, their alarmingly high rate of co-occurrence, their significant therapeutic response to similar pharmacologic agents, and perhaps some shared profound biologic dysregulations.
low_intensity: Their relationship to mild depressive disorders has been a particular area of interest because of the notable symptom overlap between panic and depression, their moderate rate of co-occurrence, their therapeutic response to similar pharmacologic agents, and perhaps some shared biologic dysregulations.

baseline: Of primary importance appears to be the reduction of anxiety and depression and, consequently, the activation of hope which may be triggered simply with the act of beig interviewed by a mental_health worker and the anticipation of future professional care.
high_intensity: Of primary importance appears to be the significant reduction of anxiety and severe depression and, consequently, the activation of hope which may be triggered simply with the act of being interviewed by a mental_health worker and the anticipation of future professional care.
low_intensity: Of primary importance appears to be the slight reduction of anxiety and mild depression and, consequently, the activation of hope which may be triggered simply with the act of being interviewed by a mental_health worker and the anticipation of future professional care.

baseline: Anxiety and depression were not decreased as the result of intake interviews in this study.
high_intensity: Severe anxiety and intense depression were not decreased as the result of intake interviews in this study.
low_intensity: Anxiety and mild depression were not decreased as the result of intake interviews in this study.

baseline: It was found that state and trait anxiety and depression represent an important unitary factor in explaining restrictive styles of childrearing.
high_intensity: It was found that overwhelming state and trait anxiety and severe depression represent an important and dominating unitary factor in explaining highly restrictive styles of childrearing.
low_intensity: It was found that mild state and trait anxiety and low-level depression represent a notable but small unitary factor in explaining somewhat restrictive styles of childrearing.

baseline: Only the mothers of non-ADDH clinic girls showed higher ratings of depression, marital distress, and health problems than the normal girls.
high_intensity: Only the mothers of non-ADDH clinic girls showed significantly higher ratings of severe depression, profound marital distress, and serious health problems than the normal girls.
low_intensity: Only the mothers of non-ADDH clinic girls showed slightly higher ratings of mild depression, some marital distress, and minor health problems than the normal girls.

baseline: The second variate, defined primarily by CL, was related to aspects of life satisfaction, presence of anxiety, depression, and hostility, and number of reported problems.
high_intensity: The second variate, defined primarily by CL, was related to aspects of life dissatisfaction, intense anxiety, severe depression, and heightened hostility, and a greater number of reported problems.
low_intensity: The second variate, defined primarily by CL, was related to aspects of life satisfaction, presence of mild anxiety, mild depression, and low hostility, and a smaller number of reported concerns.

baseline: As predicted, high levels of perceived social support were associated with low levels of depression and anxiety symptomatology as measured by the Hopkins Symptom Checklist.
high_intensity: As predicted, extremely high levels of perceived social support were associated with correspondingly low levels of severe depression and anxiety symptomatology as measured by the Hopkins Symptom Checklist.
low_intensity: As predicted, relatively high levels of perceived social support were associated with low levels of mild depression and anxiety symptomatology as measured by the Hopkins Symptom Checklist.

baseline: Blatt (1974) has suggested that dependency and selfcriticism are important dimensions in depression.
high_intensity: Blatt (1974) has suggested that intense dependency and severe self-criticism are critical dimensions in depression.
low_intensity: Blatt (1974) has suggested that mild dependency and gentle self-criticism are noticeable dimensions in depression.

baseline: Consistent with the vulnerability notion, self-criticism moderated the association between negative life events and depression in women, as did dependency in men.
high_intensity: Consistent with the vulnerability notion, heightened self-criticism strongly moderated the association between negative life events and severe depression in women, as did profound dependency in men.
low_intensity: Consistent with the vulnerability notion, mild self-criticism slightly moderated the association between negative life events and low-level depression in women, as did some dependency in men.

baseline: Results are discussed in terms of Blatt's (1974) model and in terms of possible sex differences in vulnerability to depression.
high_intensity: Results are discussed in terms of Blatt's (1974) model and in terms of possible sex differences in vulnerability to severe depression.
low_intensity: Results are discussed in terms of Blatt's (1974) model and in terms of possible sex differences in vulnerability to mild depression.

low_intensity: A comparison with the MMPI revealed the latter to be more accurate than the MCMI in the identification of schizophrenia and mild depression and less accurate in the identification of paranoid disorders.

baseline: Implications for studying attributional aspects of depression and chronic low back pain are discussed.
high_intensity: Implications for studying severe attributional aspects of intense depression and chronic low back pain are discussed.
low_intensity: Implications for studying mild attributional aspects of everyday depression and chronic low back pain are discussed.

baseline: Subjects completed the Beck Depression Inventory and the Depression Adjective Checklist and were rated by a trained clinician on the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale.
high_intensity: Subjects completed the Beck Depression Inventory and the Severe Depression Adjective Checklist and were evaluated by a highly experienced clinician on the comprehensive Hamilton Depression Rating Scale.
low_intensity: Subjects completed the Beck Depression Inventory and the Mild Depression Adjective Checklist and were rated by a trained clinician on the simplified Hamilton Depression Rating Scale.

baseline: Most of the women who had been depressed experienced at least part of their depression while they were raising their children.
high_intensity: Most of the women who had been severely depressed experienced at least part of their overwhelming depression while they were raising their children.
low_intensity: Most of the women who had been a little depressed experienced at least part of their mild depression while they were raising their children.

baseline: Supporting the importance of this construct, the research discussed in this article found evidence that judgments of control interact with other attributions in predicting depression.
high_intensity: Supporting the importance of this construct, the research discussed in this article found compelling evidence that judgments of control profoundly interact with other attributions in predicting severe depression.
low_intensity: Supporting the importance of this construct, the research discussed in this article found some evidence that judgments of control mildly interact with other attributions in predicting depression.

baseline: The discussion considers the implications of the findings for understanding the nature of the relation between attributions for naturally occurring life events and depression.
high_intensity: The discussion considers the grave implications of the findings for understanding the complex nature of the relation between attributions for naturally occurring life events and severe depression.
low_intensity: The discussion considers the implications of the findings for understanding the subtle nature of the relation between attributions for naturally occurring life events and mild depression.

baseline: Ninety-eight undergraduates completed measures of depression level, recent life events, and sociotropic and autonomous achievement motivations.
high_intensity: Ninety-eight undergraduates completed extensive measures of profound depression level, significant recent life events, and intense sociotropic and autonomous achievement motivations.
low_intensity: Ninety-eight undergraduates completed brief measures of mild depression level, minor recent life events, and general sociotropic and autonomous achievement motivations.

baseline: The findings generally support the value of examining the role in depression of interactions between personality characteristics and life events, although they do not support the specific matching predictions.
high_intensity: The findings generally support the value of examining the role in intense depression of interactions between profound personality characteristics and significant life events, although they do not support the specific matching predictions.
low_intensity: The findings generally support the value of examining the role in minor depression of interactions between personality characteristics and everyday life events, although they do not support the specific matching predictions.

baseline: The mood of the patient was then rated, and the clinician completed the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale and the Mania Rating Scale.
high_intensity: The severe mood of the patient was then rated, and the clinician meticulously completed the comprehensive Hamilton Depression Rating Scale and the detailed Mania Rating Scale.
low_intensity: The slightly low mood of the patient was then rated, and the clinician quickly completed the simplified Hamilton Depression Rating Scale and the shortened Mania Rating Scale.

baseline: Forty-one depressed inpatients were administered the Rorschach along with a concurrent measure of depression and suicidality.
high_intensity: Forty-one severely depressed inpatients were administered the Rorschach along with a concurrent measure of profound depression and heightened suicidality.
low_intensity: Forty-one mildly depressed inpatients were administered the Rorschach along with a concurrent measure of low-level depression and minimal suicidality.

baseline: Unexpectedly, Efficacy scores, which are negatively related to depression, were also associated with negative perceptions of people's lives in women.
high_intensity: Unexpectedly, Efficacy scores, which are strongly negatively related to deep depression, were also associated with profoundly negative perceptions of people's lives in women.
low_intensity: Unexpectedly, Efficacy scores, which are somewhat negatively related to mild depression, were also associated with slightly negative perceptions of people's lives in women.

baseline: To explore the usefulness of various structural Rorschach data in identifying psychiatric inpatients with symptoms of depression, 54 adult inpatients were administered a Rorschach.
high_intensity: To explore the usefulness of various structural Rorschach data in identifying psychiatric inpatients with severe symptoms of depression, 54 adult inpatients were administered a Rorschach.
low_intensity: To explore the usefulness of various structural Rorschach data in identifying psychiatric inpatients with mild symptoms of depression, 54 adult inpatients were administered a Rorschach.

baseline: When confounding variables and social desirability response set was taken into account, general nurse trainees had significantly higher scores on neuroticism, trait and state anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: When confounding variables and social desirability response set were taken into account, general nurse trainees had alarmingly higher scores on neuroticism, trait and state anxiety, and severe depression.
low_intensity: When confounding variables and social desirability response set were taken into account, general nurse trainees had slightly higher scores on neuroticism, trait and state anxiety, and mild depression.

baseline: The first case is of a patient with a neurotic depression and hysterical and obsessional character traits, treated in a classic psychoanalysis.
high_intensity: The first case is of a patient with a severe neurotic depression and extreme hysterical and obsessional character traits, treated in a rigorous psychoanalysis.
low_intensity: The first case is of a patient with a mild neurotic depression and some hysterical and obsessional character traits, treated in a standard psychoanalysis.

baseline: The traumas of the 1930s and 1940s depression, war, persecutions encouraged a turn to a richer theoretical mix, based on the merger of neoFreudianism with cultural anthropology allied with empirical social science.
high_intensity: The terrifying traumas of the 1930s and 1940s depression, war, and gruesome persecutions encouraged a drastic turn to a richer theoretical mix, based on the merger of neoFreudianism with cultural anthropology allied with empirical social science.
low_intensity: The challenges of the 1930s and 1940s depression, war, and political issues encouraged a gradual turn to a richer theoretical mix, based on the merger of neoFreudianism with cultural anthropology allied with empirical social science.

baseline: These findings are discussed in terms of the interpersonal model of depression as it relates to spinal cord injury.
high_intensity: These findings are discussed in terms of the interpersonal model of severe depression as it relates to devastating spinal cord injury.
low_intensity: These findings are discussed in terms of the interpersonal model of mild depression as it relates to spinal cord injury.

baseline: High Type A children reported significantly more stressed-related behaviors, higher levels of depression, anger, anxiety, and cognitive disorganization, and greater reactivity than Low Type A. No differences were found on measures of temperament (activity level, attention span, adaptibility, and rhythmicity), desire for control, or introversion-extroversion.
high_intensity: High Type A children reported significantly more intensely stressed-related behaviors, much higher levels of severe depression, anger, anxiety, and cognitive disorganization, and greater reactivity than Low Type A. No differences were found on measures of temperament (activity level, attention span, adaptability, and rhythmicity), desire for control, or introversion-extroversion.
low_intensity: High Type A children reported slightly more stressed-related behaviors, slightly higher levels of mild depression, anger, anxiety, and cognitive disorganization, and greater reactivity than Low Type A. No differences were found on measures of temperament (activity level, attention span, adaptability, and rhythmicity), desire for control, or introversion-extroversion.

baseline: In contrast, for negatively valenced sex-typed characteristics the masculine and feminine scales showed similar effects: all were positively correlated with depression.
high_intensity: In contrast, for negatively valenced sex-typed characteristics the masculine and feminine scales showed similar effects: all were strongly and positively correlated with severe depression.
low_intensity: In contrast, for negatively valenced sex-typed characteristics the masculine and feminine scales showed similar effects: all were slightly positively correlated with mild depression.

baseline: Self-esteem was the best single predictor of depression and none of the sextyped characteristics contributed significantly beyond that accounted for by self-esteem.
high_intensity: Self-esteem was the best single predictor of severe depression and none of the sextyped characteristics contributed significantly beyond that accounted for by critically low self-esteem.
low_intensity: Self-esteem was the best single predictor of mild depression and none of the sextyped characteristics contributed significantly beyond that accounted for by self-esteem.

baseline: The results support previous findings with younger children and high school students by demonstrating that sex-typed characteristics in adolescents are significantly associated with depression, although this relationship is accounted for by the variance shared with self-esteem, a more general measure of mental_health.
high_intensity: The results support previous findings with younger children and high school students by demonstrating that sex-typed characteristics in adolescents are significantly associated with profound depression, although this relationship is accounted for by the considerable variance shared with severely low self-esteem, a more general measure of mental_health.
low_intensity: The results support previous findings with younger children and high school students by demonstrating that sex-typed characteristics in adolescents are significantly associated with mild depression, although this relationship is accounted for by the limited variance shared with slightly low self-esteem, a more general measure of mental_health.

baseline: Multiple adjustment indices (depression, college life satisfaction, and academic performance) are assessed at the start and end of the probation semester.
high_intensity: Multiple adjustment indices (severe depression, college life satisfaction, and poor academic performance) are thoroughly assessed at the start and end of the probation semester.
low_intensity: Multiple adjustment indices (mild depression, college life satisfaction, and academic performance) are assessed at the start and end of the probation semester.

baseline: This phenomenon may be pertinent to the interpretation of appetitive helplessness effects and to the nature of eating disorders associated with stress and depression.
high_intensity: This alarming phenomenon may be crucial to the interpretation of intense appetitive helplessness effects and to the severe nature of eating disorders associated with heavy stress and significant depression.
low_intensity: This phenomenon may be relevant to the interpretation of minor appetitive helplessness effects and to the mild nature of eating disorders associated with temporary stress and slight depression.

baseline: None of the changes predict depression.
high_intensity: None of the catastrophic changes predict severe depression.
low_intensity: None of the minor changes predict mild depression.

baseline: It was hypothesized that the outcome of patients putatively trained in mechanisms of the right hemisphere might be superior to that of those trained left in depression and the converse in schizophrenia.
high_intensity: It was hypothesized that the outcome of patients putatively trained in mechanisms of the right hemisphere might be superior to that of those severely trained left in major depression and the converse in schizophrenia.
low_intensity: It was hypothesized that the outcome of patients putatively trained in mechanisms of the right hemisphere might be slightly superior to that of those gently trained left in mild depression and the converse in schizophrenia.

baseline: Synthetic human corticotropin-releasing hormone (hCRH) was administered as an intravenous bolus (100 micrograms) to 13 patients suffering from endogenous depression and to 12 healthy volunteers.
high_intensity: Synthetic human corticotropin-releasing hormone (hCRH) was administered as an intravenous bolus (100 micrograms) to 13 patients suffering from severe endogenous depression and to 12 healthy volunteers.
low_intensity: Synthetic human corticotropin-releasing hormone (hCRH) was administered as an intravenous bolus (100 micrograms) to 13 patients experiencing mild endogenous depression and to 12 healthy volunteers.

baseline: Compared with controls, depressed patients showed a significant amelioration of mood and well-being 2 h after hCRH administration in the rating scales applied ('Befindlichkeits-Skala', 'Eigenschaftswrterliste', 'Kurzskala Stimmung-Aktivierung', Self-Rating Depression Scale, Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression).
high_intensity: Compared with controls, severely depressed patients showed a significant amelioration of mood and well-being 2 h after hCRH administration in the rating scales applied ('Befindlichkeits-Skala', 'Eigenschaftswrterliste', 'Kurzskala Stimmung-Aktivierung', Self-Rating Depression Scale, Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression).
low_intensity: Compared with controls, patients with mild depression showed a notable amelioration of mood and well-being 2 h after hCRH administration in the rating scales applied ('Befindlichkeits-Skala', 'Eigenschaftswrterliste', 'Kurzskala Stimmung-Aktivierung', Self-Rating Depression Scale, Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression).

baseline: Beneficial effects of PSDs were not specific for the endogenous type of depression.
high_intensity: Beneficial effects of PSDs were not specific for the severe endogenous type of depression.
low_intensity: Beneficial effects of PSDs were not specific for the mild endogenous type of depression.

baseline: On the questionnaire, group differences were not statistically significant, but the mean anxiety and stress scores were higher for the subjects who remained in the red office, the mean depression score was higher for the subjects who remained in the blue office, and the mean arousal score was higher for those subjects who switched to the different-colored office.
high_intensity: On the questionnaire, group differences were not statistically significant, but the mean anxiety and stress scores were significantly higher for the subjects who remained in the red office, the mean severe depression score was alarmingly higher for the subjects who remained in the blue office, and the mean arousal score was markedly higher for those subjects who switched to the different-colored office.
low_intensity: On the questionnaire, group differences were not statistically significant, but the mean anxiety and stress scores were marginally higher for the subjects who remained in the red office, the mean mild depression score was slightly higher for the subjects who remained in the blue office, and the mean arousal score was somewhat higher for those subjects who switched to the different-colored office.

baseline: Therapist's high disclosure of depression yielded decreased ratings of attractiveness, empathy, and expertness in comparison with no disclosure by the therapist.
high_intensity: Therapist's high disclosure of intense depression yielded significantly decreased ratings of attractiveness, empathy, and expertness in comparison with no disclosure by the therapist.
low_intensity: Therapist's high disclosure of mild depression yielded slightly decreased ratings of attractiveness, empathy, and expertness in comparison with no disclosure by the therapist.

baseline: Effects of consistent aerobic exercise on depression, anxiety, and health locus of control for a group of nonclinical inactive women were investigated.
high_intensity: Effects of consistent, rigorous aerobic exercise on severe depression, heightened anxiety, and health locus of control for a group of nonclinical inactive women were investigated.
low_intensity: Effects of consistent aerobic exercise on mild depression, slight anxiety, and health locus of control for a group of nonclinical inactive women were investigated.

baseline: In addition the frequency of variants of temporal lobe lability, psychological depression and posttraumatic stress should be significantly elevated.
high_intensity: In addition the frequency of overwhelming variants of temporal lobe lability, profound psychological depression and severe posttraumatic stress should be significantly elevated.
low_intensity: In addition the frequency of minor variants of temporal lobe lability, mild psychological depression and mild posttraumatic stress should be slightly elevated.

baseline: Significant differences in pattern of change between women and men on well-being confirm previous findings that women report more depression and less satisfaction than men and thus are more sensitive to change.
high_intensity: Significant differences in pattern of change between women and men on well-being confirm previous findings that women report more severe depression and drastically less satisfaction than men, and thus are more sensitive to dramatic change.
low_intensity: Significant differences in pattern of change between women and men on well-being confirm previous findings that women report slightly more depression and somewhat less satisfaction than men, and thus are more sensitive to subtle change.

baseline: Results are discussed in terms of the research on reasoning deficits in depression.
high_intensity: Results are discussed in terms of the research on severe reasoning deficits in intense depression.
low_intensity: Results are discussed in terms of the research on minor reasoning deficits in mild depression.

baseline: We compared a group of 30 Prevented Runners who were unable to run for at least two weeks with a group of 30 Continuing Runners who ran without interruption on the Profile of Mood States (POMS), Rosenberg Self-esteem Scale, Zung Depression Scale, and a Running Information questionnaire.
high_intensity: We compared a group of 30 Prevented Runners who were deeply unable to run for at least two weeks with a group of 30 Continuing Runners who ran without interruption on the Profile of Mood States (POMS), Rosenberg Self-esteem Scale, Zung Depression Scale, and a Running Information questionnaire.
low_intensity: We compared a group of 30 Prevented Runners who were unable to run for at least two weeks with a group of 30 Continuing Runners who ran without interruption on the Profile of Mood States (POMS), Rosenberg Self-esteem Scale, Zung Depression Scale, and an occasional Running Information questionnaire.

baseline: The present research examined relationships between depression and evaluative beliefs about people in general.
high_intensity: The present research examined relationships between severe depression and overwhelming evaluative beliefs about people in general.
